programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Water's Edge Guest House in Stratford-upon-Avon, where owner Julie Allison and friend Gerry Crabtree hope their luxurious approach will win the day.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Kilpeck Inn in Herefordshire where head chef Ross Williams and front of house manager Kath Capel consider no detail too small.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Fox Inn in Guisborough, where hosts Michael Crane and Jai Bennison hope to impress their guests with their northern B&B.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests check in at Ivanhoe Guest House in Bridlington, where Mick and Gill Jennings hope their simple approach will win the day. But Michael is quick to pick fault.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees Ross and Kath from The Kilpeck Inn confront Julie and Gerry's low hosting score, and accusations of tit-for-tat game-playing start to fly.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Ray Dodd hosts the first dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but finds his guests a difficult crowd to please. Recruitment executive Michelle Watson turns her nose up at the salmon starter, while choir director Joseph Benneh sends his steak back to the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment executive Michelle Watson welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but the previous night's host Ray Dodd is hungry for revenge following stinging criticism of his efforts. Michelle's cooking also fails to impress Joseph Benneh, so her hopes of scooping the week's prize rest with her choice of entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stuart Henson hosts a safari-themed dinner party on the third night in Milton Keynes. He hopes his exotic menu of zebra steak and `elephant dung surprise' will please his guests, but after the insults of the previous night he faces a difficult challenge to persuade his fellow diners to get along.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Choir director Joseph Benneh hosts the fourth dinner party in Milton Keynes, hoping the flavours from his homeland Ghana and a vocal masterclass will prove a winning combination. The guests' expectations are high, so he is under pressure to hit the spot with a menu that includes chicken liver pate, and groundnut soup with coconut rice.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Country enthusiast Susan Rogers hosts the final dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, hoping her French cuisine will win her extra points. She also demonstrates her skills with an accordion and gives her guests an origami masterclass, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Prohibition Grille in Everett, Washington, where he meets belly dancer-turned-restaurateur Rishi Brown, who is making all the wrong moves with her business. Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, she's oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef heads to the Seascape restaurant in the village of Islip on Long Island, New York, in a bid to change the fortunes of its owner, who is nearly $1million in debt. Gordon is dismayed to discover unprotected meat and fish left next to mouldy pesto jars in the kitchen and plans to close down the eatery until radical changes are made.(n)

programme.title: The Book of Life
programme.desc: Premiere. A man who longs to be a musician instead of a bullfighter like his father has to compete with a childhood friend when they fall for the same woman. Their love triangle catches the eye of the spirits of the dead, leading him on a journey through their bizarre world. Animated adventure, with the voices of Diego Luna, Zoe Saldana and Channing Tatum.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Nashville, Tennessee, the spiritual home of country music, but his visit begins on a sour note at Chappy's Cajun restaurant. Chef John Chapman's careless methods have damaged his reputation, but he blames the local clientele rather than his less-than-appetising food and disturbing kitchen practices. Can Gordon get through to this stubborn owner and save the eatery from disaster?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Scottsdale, Arizona, where he meets husband-and-wife bistro owners Samy and Amy Bouzaglo, who reveal a shocking contempt for customer feedback. The chef faces the biggest challenge of the series to save Amy's Baking Company, but can he get through to this defiant pair?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to floundering soul food restaurant Blackberry's in Plainfield, New Jersey, but struggles to get his message across to indomitable owner Shelley. Her refusal to deal with the truth comes to a head when Gordon finds a dead mouse in the doorway, prompting him to step up his efforts to change her ways.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Joe Lycett taking on Sean Lock and Michelle Wolf. Adam Riches joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors treat a young woman who has been thrown from a horse, which then trampled on her, and also a woman who was hit by a car while riding her motorbike on a dual carriageway. Plus, an 11-year-old boy is brought into hospital after running into a wall at school and hurting his wrist.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eighteen-year-old Lewis is rushed into the hospital after coming off his motorbike and colliding with two cars. He is immediately taken for a full body CT scan as doctors are concerned about the extent of the injuries to his pelvis, arm and head. Meanwhile, 27-year-old Sam awaits X-ray results after he fainted and cut his lip while smoking a Cuban cigar at a barbecue.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Cameras follow Jody and Chris, who struggled with infertility, and are now awaiting the arrival of their first child at Liverpool Women's Hospital. There's also a look at expectant Mormon couple Cameron and Hannah, and Lesley, a single mum-to-be who plans on raising her baby alone.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Archaeologist Sophie hopes Second World War enthusiast Mark will be the man for her. Also entering the romantic restaurant is comedian Kelly, who worries that she tends to intimidate men. Can high-flying entrepreneur Russell handle her banter? Plus, mum-of-four Heather, 72, hopes retired businessman Gary will keep her company in her twilight years.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: A man arrives at Luton police station claiming his life is in danger and that he has just escaped from a slave-owning gang that held him captive at a travellers' site in a remote part of Bedfordshire. Cameras follow as a major operation is launched to investigate the allegations, with more than 200 officers drafted in for a dawn raid on the site to arrest their suspects.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by comedy actress Kathy Burke for a comic review of the significant moments of the past seven days. The quartet offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: Is it OK?.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. First up is 24-year-old Rebecca, a singer from Nottinghamshire who is tired of always having her heart broken by guys with a bad boy image and wants to see if choosing a date in the studio can help her pick a better mate. Next up is 25-year-old development manager Dan from Durham, who has unsuccessfully tried countless dating apps and hopes to find Mr Right.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Chris and Dan Boettcher from Bedfordshire find a holiday home in the Axarquia region of Spain's Costa del Sol on their budget of £70,000. They view five properties, hoping one of them will be the retreat they can escape to with their family without too much prior planning.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Recently divorced Patricia Malty from Devon wants to make a fresh start on the Costa Calida in Spain after selling her home and moving in with her best friend, with Laura Hamilton helping her find suitable properties for her £90,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Tony and Lisa Meredith have aspired to own a holiday home in South Tenerife for years, and are ready to pursue their dream now that their children have left home. Jasmine Harman helps them navigate the local property market and shows them an apartment with amazing views for almost £20,000 under their £100,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Retirement is fast approaching for Chris Wood and Eleanor Clements, who are looking for a holiday home on the coast of north Tenerife where they can spend the winter months. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties, including some stunning cliff-top apartments, within their £120,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Reg and Aby Solomon from Hertfordshire look to buy a family holiday home near the Spanish town of Denia on the popular Costa Blanca. Laura Hamilton searches every nook and cranny of the local market in an attempt to find properties that match the couple's £200,000 budget, but it remains to be seen whether she can deliver the perfect place in the perfect location.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef comes to the aid of an Italian restaurant in New Jersey, which is struggling due to a cumbersome menu, an unruly kitchen and confused staff. Gordon suggests carefully prepared meatballs will be popular with the clientele, but owner Joe Cerniglia needs to make some big changes.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer helps a couple who are at loggerheads over their priorities for their next property, with Becki wanting a ready-to-move-into family home, while Craig is looking for a bargain project in the popular suburbs of south Manchester. Kirstie Allsopp meets newlyweds Chris and Amy in Cheshire, who are looking to buy their first home together and want something semi-rural in pricey areas including Knutsford, Lymm and Frodsham.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers searching for properties in south London. Niki and Rob have £450,000 and want a home with enough space to allow them to start a family in the future, while Georgie and Louis have been commuting from Surrey for years and feel the time is right to move to the capital. But what will they find with a £220,000 budget?.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which Timothy West and Prunella Scales explore India by canal boat. The trip begins in Kerala, a region of palm-fringed lakes, rivers and British-built canals which has had a thriving spice trade for thousands of years. They explore a boat built by a local ruler and make offerings at a temple, while Pru learns a traditional dance.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs

programme.title: Ackley Bridge
programme.desc: Missy convinces Nas to make a play for her teacher, Lila, but Nas is served a curve ball when her dad announces that he has other plans for her. Confused and emotional, Nas appeals to Lila for help, but Lila draws a line under their friendship. Missy resolves to show her that there are plenty more fish in the sea, though Nas does not take to Missy's expedition to a gay bar and leaves alone early. Meanwhile, a guilt-stricken Mandy ends things with Sadiq and throws herself back into her marriage, and Emma discovers that Samir is engaged.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Paul Bohill and Phil Short must deal with a negligent tenant who fled upon their arrival, forcing the agents to set a trap in order to evict him. Meanwhile, Brian O'Shaughnessy and Kevin Stokes chase a debt of £5,000 in Kent, before heading to Surrey to recover £11,000 owed by the owner a bespoke furniture business. Plus, Paul and Steve Pinner's patience is tested to the limit when they are sent to carry out an eviction in London.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Paul and Steve face a moral dilemma in south London, when they find out the tenant they have been instructed to evict is on his way to a funeral. Elsewhere, Stewart and Victor chase £1,000 from a debtor who has defaulted on his payment plan, but they are subjected to abuse and the police are called to a driveway standoff. Plus, two agents try to recover £1,600 worth of goods from the owner of an entertainment company after a wedding day dispute, and in west London, a landlady is owned £9,000 in rent arrears by a young mother.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away

Another case sees Stewart and Victor hunting down a £3,000 debt owed by a Liverpool takeaway for rent arrears.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date

Plus, Paul catches up with last week's matches to discover whether their first dates were a success.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: The documentary meets claimants living on the breadline in Yorkshire. They include 45-year-old Alex, who dreams of making it as a DJ and has just blown thousands of pounds on record decks, and Geordie couple Michelle and Thomas, who are now living in Leeds, where they are pushing for their children to have a better future. Plus, a Whitby man who says the sickness benefit he receives is only enough to feed his partner and baby daughter five days out of every seven.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: People coping with medical conditions on top of their financial difficulties, featuring a family of four from Whitby who include a father with Tourette's and an autistic son. In Doncaster, a woman with cerebral palsy needs round-the-clock care, but that does not stop her campaigning for animal rights, while in Barnsley, a hoarder with a flat full of clutter has been deemed fit to work despite her arthritis - and now she has the bailiffs chasing her.(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: A man living in a bleak future years after a nuclear war has fake memories of being a secret agent implanted into his brain. However, the procedure uncovers the fact that he really is a spy with his memory erased, and he is forced to become a fugitive from the totalitarian government. Sci-fi thriller remake, with Colin Farrell, Kate Beckinsale and Jessica Biel.(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: One the most talked about and successful horror movies of all time. A priest is called to exorcise a powerful demon that has taken over a young girl. Oscar-winning adaptation of William Peter Blatty's shocking bestselling novel(n)

programme.title: Ricochet
programme.desc: A cop receives lots of media attention when he nabs an infamous, sadistic killer at an amusement park. The murderer stews in jail for seven years, obsessively following the rising career of his arresting officer, who becomes a DA with a promising future, a husband, and a dad. This doesn't sit well with the vengeful convict, who after escaping from prison, puts into play a series of fiendish plots in an attempt to destroy the attorney's marriage and career..(n)

programme.desc: A young couple staying at a remote holiday spot are terrorized by masked intruders(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Bobby and Peter Farrelly co-directed this irreverent comedy about conjoined twins. Greg Kinnear and Matt Damon star as Walt and Bob, brothers who literally stick together through thick and thin. That bond is tested, however, when Walt becomes an actor in Hollywood(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Three New York drag queens travel cross-country on their way to Hollywood, but a broken-down car strands them in a narrow-minded country town, where they share makeup tips with the ladies and show the hostile men how to treat women right(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: A failed actor turned drama teacher attempts to make a splash by staging a controversial sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: In this moving drama, two aging friends, one a retired composer and the other a filmmaker working on a new project, go on vacation together at a spa resort in the Alps. There, they take stock of their lives and reflect on their artistic accomplishments(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: A party-centric fraternity causes all sorts of havoc and hijinks on a college campus in the early 1960s, leading to their expulsion and a grand act of revenge(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Two street racers, Brian O'Conner and Roman Pearce go undercover to bust a drug trafficking operation(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: A biography of Howard Hughes, centering on his glory years from the 1920s to the 1940s. After making a fortune improving the design of oil drilling bits, Hughes becomes the Hollywood mogul behind RKO studios, and devotes his lief to aviation. The film also depicts Hughes' romances Hollywood starlets Jean Harlow and Katharine Hepburn(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: Based on a true event, the film follows the 2010 mining disaster incident where a group of thirty-three miners were trapped inside the San Jose mine in Chile for more than two months after a gold and copper mine collapses(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: When a horrific murder rocks the peaceful community of Holcomb, Kansas, legendary writer Truman Capote is inspired to record the shocking true story in his novel IN COLD BLOOD. Capote--accompanied by fellow wordsmith Nell Harper Lee (TO KILL A MOCKINGBIRD)--travels to the Midwest in search of answers, and ends up becoming emotionally involved with one of the killers as they await trial(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: Undercover FBI agent Johnny Utah (Luke Bracey) infiltrates a group of extreme athletes who are using their specialized skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. This action thriller is a remake of the 1991 cult hit of the same name, and features a number of real-life extreme athletes performing the stunts, which include free rock climbing, wingsuit flying, and motocross riding. Edgar Ramirez and Teresa Palmer co-star. Directed by Ericson Core (Invincible)(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: An emotional tale of a widow whose late husband had arranged for her to receive a series of his letters to help her move on in life without him(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: Ted (voice of Seth MacFarlane) ties the knot with Tami-Lynn (Jessica Barth), and recruits his best friend John (Mark Wahlberg) as a sperm donor in order to start a family in this sequel to the comedy hit about a teddy bear come to life. Later, when the Commonwealth of Massachusetts demands that Ted appear before a judge to prove he's a real person, the frisky bear and his pal vow to fight for their civil rights. Morgan Freeman and Amanda Seyfried co-star(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: Biopic of entrepreneur Joy Mangano (Jennifer Lawrence), a divorced mother of two who risks her life's savings to produce and market her invention, the Miracle Mop. Joy faces opposition from her dysfunctional family, including her father Rudy (Robert De Niro), as they meddle in her burgeoning business. But when the head of the newly founded QVC network (Bradley Cooper) gives her a chance to sell her product on live TV, the Miracle Mop becomes a household name. The success of that invention later leads to a home-shopping empire and Joy's ascension to the matriarch of her extended family. David O. Russell directed this briskly paced comedy-drama, with Diane Ladd, Virginia Madsen, Isabella Rossellini, and Elisabeth Röhm co-starring(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: This epic sci-fi actioner is set 200 years in the future. The polar ice caps have melted, flooding the continents and creating a giant ocean. People are few and far between, living as sailors or on rickety atolls made from scrap metal; in this time, dry land is considered a myth and dirt and water have become the most valuable currency. The film begins as a mysterious Mariner aboard his ingenious trimaran urinates carefully into a small jar. He then pours the golden liquid into a filtration device that purifies it and makes it drinkable. The Mariner is self sufficient and eschews humanity, except for occasional stops for supplies. He is different from other humans in that he has developed functional gills and has webbed feet. Such a mutation makes him a pariah. He cruises into a rusty atoll and tries to exchange dirt for supplies. The half-crazy people within the fortress end up putting him in a cage and planning to recycle him in a bubbling vat of green effluvium. Just before he is to die, the fortress is attacked by a flotilla of Smokers (tobacco addicted sea bikers) led by the bald, one-eyed and crazy Deacon who has come to search for a little girl with a strange tattoo on her back that is said to be a map leading to dry land. The girl and her mother escape with the reluctant Mariner. Eventually Deacon and the Smokers capture the girl and it is up to the fishy stranger to save her from their hulking lair (which turns out to be the notorious wreck of the Exxon Valdez)(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: Robin of Locksley returns from the Crusades to find the Sheriff of Nottingham making life miserable for the peasants of Sherwood Forest, and recruits a noble band of allies to help him defeat the dastardly lawman(n)

programme.title: Silk
programme.desc: In the 19th century, after a disease wipes out his African supply of silkworms, married French merchant Hervé Joncour travels to Japan, invited by a wealthy baron, to collect a clandestine cargo. During his stay, he spots the magnate's beautiful Japanese concubine and becomes obsessed with her. He goes back to his country and they start to communicate through letters until war intervenes. But their love persists, and Hervé's wife Helene begins to suspect(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: In this amusing fish-out-of-water workplace comedy, a 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy start-up fashion company. Later, he unexpectedly becomes a confidant for the overwhelmed young CEO(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: Joe Buck (John Voight) is the naive Texas dishwasher who leaves his tiny town for a life as a male prostitute in New York City. He quits his job and gets on a northbound bus. The rural rube encounters the brassy Cass (Sylvia Miles) and believes he has his first paying customer, but the Jewish princess brings out the crying towel in mock humiliation. Joe ends up giving her money for cab fare as his experience foreshadows other demoralizing events. He meets local street hustler Ratso Rizzo (Dustin Hoffman) who relieves Joe of some more cash and sends him to the demented religious fanatic O'Daniel (John McGiver). Joe is horrified to learn O'Daniel is not a pimp and flees his seedy apartment. Wandering the cold, lonely streets, Joe is amazed that a dead man on the sidewalk draws no attention or interest from the locals. He meets up with the conniving Ratso and threatens to kill him if he doesn't return the money. Ratso gives Joe a place to stay in a condemned apartment building where the two scrounge for survival as winter approaches. Joe is reduced to allowing himself to be used for homosexual sex and a young college student fails to pay for his services. Ratso and Joe attend a trendy, drug soaked Manhattan party where he meets the stoned Shirley (Brenda Vaccaro), who pays Joe double the asking price for his sexual services. Ratso is already a cripple who finds his health worsening with the arrival of winter. Joe returns Ratso's kindness by vowing to take the ailing petty thief to Miami. While Ratso dreams of sun, fun and bikini clad women, Joe encounters a simpering, middle-aged homosexual from Chicago in town for a convention. He asks the man for money but is far short of the amount needed for two-one way trips to Florida on the Greyhound bus. Joe knocks out the man's dentures and sticks telephone receiver down the man's throat. By now Ratso is convinced he will be preyed upon in the mean streets of New York if he doesn't get to warm weather soon. Midnight Cowboy won the Oscar for Best Picture, Best screenplay (Waldo Salt) and Best Director (John Schlesinger). Hoffman, Voight, and Miles were nominated for their performances. Fred Neil's song "Everybody's Talking" was a smash for Nillson. Warren Zevon wrote a song, and The Group and Elephant's Memory also contributed to the memorable soundtrack. The film was rated X at the time and it the only X rated feature to win the Academy Award(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: In this galvanizing feminist drama, a working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalized when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: Death is coming. And Alex Browning is cursed with knowing when, how and where the grim reaper will take his next victim to the Final Destination. After boarding a plane to Europe with his fellow French club members, high school student Alex Browning has a premonition of the aircraft exploding moments after takeoff, killing every on board. Alex panics, insisting that everyone get off the plane. In the melee than ensues, seven people, including Alex, are forced to disembark--saving them from a fiery death when the plan explodes as Alex foresaw. But as, one by one, each of these seven who cheated fate meets an untimely end, Alex and his remaining friends band together to try change destiny and outwit the untamable forces of death. Starring Devon Sawa, Ali Larter & Kerr Smith(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Catch a Contractor
programme.desc: Adam Carolla and Skip Bedell set out to locate shady contractor Pedro, who promised the Kungl family he would install a skylight, but instead bodged everything that he touched and left the property full of leaks.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Finch is on the case when the number of a janitor with a haunted past comes up, only for him to discover that the threat on the man's life comes from none other than Root. Crime drama, starring Michael Emerson and Amy Acker.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: The team gets involved in international politics when Finch and Reese are given the number of a former government contractor who is stalking a UN diplomat. Meanwhile, an adversary tries to take advantage of Root. Drama, starring Jim Caviezel and Michael Emerson.(n)

programme.title: Lost Letter Mysteries: From Paris with Love
programme.desc: The postal detectives explore the mystery of true love when they deliver divorce papers to one couple on the same day as Oliver's missing wife reappears. Drama, starring Eric Mabius, Kristin Booth and Crystal Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: A Trace of Murder
programme.desc: A conniving woman yearns to divorce her husband and set up home with her lover - but a pre-nuptial agreement means she stands to lose out. Instead, she devises a cunning plan to nullify the contract, framing her unsuspecting spouse for the murder of a business rival. However, she reckons without the shabby sleuth's unfailing ability to uncover the truth. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Shera Danese, Barry Corbin and David Rasche.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to locate a kidnapped girl but has to contend with her grandfather, a former member of a disbanded special forces unit. The agents discover he has been secretly negotiating with the kidnapper, who was once in his undercover team and has decided to kill off his old colleagues in a bid to atone for their actions. Meanwhile, Abby is forced to work with an intern, and makes him follow her idiosyncratic rules. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called to the home of a bomb disposal expert who shot and killed an intruder during a robbery. The case appears to be straightforward until Tony discovers she lied about being alone during the incident, and the evidence suggests a link to a case in which a man walked free after paralysing a member of the public in a shootout. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team becomes involved in an international incident when the body of an American petty officer is found by an estate agent in a bungalow that has been repossessed. An indentation on the victim's skull leads the agents to believe he was killed on a British ship, but collecting evidence from the vessel proves challenging. Guest starring Tracy Middendorf, Daniel Gillies and Kristen Ariza.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the deaths of a radio DJ and a naval officer who were both killed during a live broadcast, only to discover there are a number of potential suspects. Evidence leads the agents to suspect the involvement of a radical group called Military at Home, prompting Tony to investigate an upmarket gated community - where his door-to-door inquiries yield an enticing proposition or two from the female residents. American drama, starring Michael Weatherly, with Nadia Bjorlin.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby becomes personally involved in the case of a murdered naval scientist who she regards as a kindred spirit. The team's initial inquiries turn up little concrete information about the victim's life, but the forensic specialist makes a breakthrough when she decodes some of the mysterious markings covering the body. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Part two of two. Hetty and the NCIS team continue trying to find the elusive black book, but face competition from foreign security agencies keen to discover the secrets it contains - and Kensi is kidnapped as the search narrows.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A petty officer arriving at airport security dies during a random search. Conducting an autopsy on the body, Dr Wade suspects that he died from natural causes. However, just as she is concluding her examination, a man enters the morgue, demanding to take the deceased back to his family. After Wade refuses, he pulls a gun and holds her, Sebastian Lund and Danny Malloy hostage. Drama, starring CCH Pounder, Scott Bakula and Lucas Black.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives investigate when a 15-year-old girl is found dead carrying her older cousin's ID, and discover she was part of an online dating group. They realise she was the object of an older man's obsession - but someone kills him before they can make an arrest.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

Crime drama, guest starring Stephanie March (Law & Order: Special Victims Unit) and Mitch Pileggi (The X Files).(n)

programme.desc: Voight faces pressure from his superiors and crosses swords with his former partner as he and the team investigate a deadly series of stings at underworld gambling dens. programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: Voight takes control of a case involving an escalating conflict between two rival gangs, and he immediately obtains a lead on the most likely suspect. However, the stakes are upped when four dead Latin priests are discovered in a field, suggesting that an all-out war is imminent. Chicago Fire spin-off, starring Jason Beghe, Jon Seda, Elias Koteas and Sophia Bush.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD

Chicago Fire spin-off, starring Jason Beghe, Jon Seda, Jesse Lee Soffer, Marina Squerciati and Patrick John Flueger.(n)

Detective drama, with Peter Falk and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's WWII blockbuster stars Tom Hanks as Capt John H Miller, leader of a platoon of D-Day soldiers ordered to find and rescue Private Ryan, part of the advance forces who is now the sole surviving sibling of a family of four brothers. The plan, a propaganda exercise propagated by Army chief George C Marshall, sees them reluctantly give up on their mission to defeat Germans and set out on their quest (although not without diversions along the way). But when they eventually find Ryan, the moral question posed by Spielberg is - what do they do next?(n)

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Denzel Washington and Chris Pine star in this intense action thriller, the final work to be directed by the late Tony Scott. Veteran railroad employee Frank Barnes has his quarrels with the young, new guy on the job, Will Colson - largely because the younger man is about to replace him. But the two must join forces and race against time when an enormous runaway train carrying toxic chemicals heads their way. If its terminal destination in a city wasn't bad enough, the lethal behemoth is also on the same line as another train, aboard which are 150 children who are returning from a school trip. When the railroad company's chairman refuses to take action for financial reasons, Frank takes it upon himself to save the day, despite the seemingly suicidal nature of the mission and the devastating consequences it's likely to have for his loved ones. Will opposes Frank's ridiculously dangerous idea, but joins him anyway. Can the two men patch up their differences and save the day? In addition to the nail-biting action, the score beautifully highlights the suspense, and earned the film a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Sound Editing(n)

programme.desc: The Price. Hawkeye and B.J. harbor a Korean draft dodger; Klinger tries to bribe his way out of the Army; Potter's mare disappears. Sun: Miko Mayama. Ham: Ken Mochizuki. Cho Pak: Yuki Shimoda. Igor: Jeff Maxwell. Zale: Johnny Haymer. Kim: Dennis Sakamoto. Hawkeye: Alan Alda. B.J.: Mike Farrell. Potter: Harry Morgan(n)

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's WWII blockbuster stars Tom Hanks as Capt John H Miller, leader of a platoon of D-Day soldiers ordered to find and rescue Private Ryan, part of the advance forces who is now the sole surviving sibling of a family of four brothers. The plan, a propaganda exercise propagated by Army chief George C Marshall, sees them reluctantly give up on their mission to defeat Germans and set out on their quest (although not without diversions along the way). But when they eventually find Ryan, the moral question posed by Spielberg is - what do they do next?(n)

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Denzel Washington and Chris Pine star in this intense action thriller, the final work to be directed by the late Tony Scott. Veteran railroad employee Frank Barnes has his quarrels with the young, new guy on the job, Will Colson - largely because the younger man is about to replace him. But the two must join forces and race against time when an enormous runaway train carrying toxic chemicals heads their way. If its terminal destination in a city wasn't bad enough, the lethal behemoth is also on the same line as another train, aboard which are 150 children who are returning from a school trip. When the railroad company's chairman refuses to take action for financial reasons, Frank takes it upon himself to save the day, despite the seemingly suicidal nature of the mission and the devastating consequences it's likely to have for his loved ones. Will opposes Frank's ridiculously dangerous idea, but joins him anyway. Can the two men patch up their differences and save the day? In addition to the nail-biting action, the score beautifully highlights the suspense, and earned the film a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Sound Editing(n)

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow
programme.desc: As Earth cracks under tornadoes, tidal waves and ice caps, scientist Dennis Quaid races to save stranded son Jake Gyllenhaal. Action. Contains violence/flashing images(n)

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.desc: 100. A mysterious character searches for purpose and soon becomes tied to the struggle over a key resource in the apocalypse(n)

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.sub-title: Burning in Water, Drowning in Flame
programme.desc: Burning in Water, Drowning in Flame. A new threat reveals itself to Madison and Troy as they search for answers. Elsewhere, Alicia must reconcile with her past decisions(n)

programme.title: Preacher
programme.desc: On the Road. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Talking Dead
programme.desc: Fear the Walking Dead 305. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Fear the Walking Dead
programme.sub-title: Burning in Water, Drowning in Flame
programme.desc: Burning in Water, Drowning in Flame. A new threat reveals itself to Madison and Troy as they search for answers. Elsewhere, Alicia must reconcile with her past decisions(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law). After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: Love and a Bullet
programme.desc: Tough gangster kid Malik 'The Ghost' Bishop swaps street crime for life as a hitman. Ordered to ice the boss' girlfriend, he finds himself falling for her and planning to quit gangland. But there's going to be bloodshed before they let him go. Crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Eddie Griffin scores as a hip secret agent in this hilarious spoof of blaxploitation flicks, directed by Malcolm D. Lee. Griffin's character works for a black spy organization that's battling "The Man" and his efforts to suppress black culture. Denise Richards costars as White She-Devil. Chris Kattan, Dave Chappelle(n)

programme.title: Bird on a Wire
programme.desc: Reunited lovers on the lam are pursued by drug runners(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: In this thrilling fourth installment of the "Jurassic Park" franchise, two young brothers visit an aunt who's an executive at Jurassic World, a theme park populated with genetically resurrected dinosaurs. But chaos erupts when a newly created dino escapes its enclosure, forcing the park's animal behaviorist to save the day(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Mark Steven Johnson's violent superhero fantasy-morality play stars Ben Affleck as Matt Murdock, a guilt-wracked blind vigilante with a penchant for red leather. During his childhood, an accident involving toxic waste blinded Murdock, but it also enhanced his other senses and gave him a kind of 'radar vision'. The incident was partially caused by his discovery that his father was involved with the Mob. Now, the adult Murdock, spurred partly by Catholic guilt over his role in his father's death, has dedicated this life to fighting crime and protecting the innocent. By day Murdock's a defence lawyer, but by night he dispenses summary justice to criminals who've escaped the courts. Things get complicated when he falls in love with Elektra Natchios (Jennifer Garner). Not only is she the daughter of a man with connections to New York crime bosses but, unknown to Murdock, she's also a vigilante who's equally keen on figure-hugging leather (black in her case). And when Daredevil is framed for the murder of her father, Elektra swears vengeance on the masked crime-fighter (not realising that he's her lover). Meanwhile, both of them are in mortal danger from the actual killer, a merciless Irish assassin called Bullseye (Colin Farrell)(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: In this thrilling and inspirational sci-fi drama, a lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: This epic sci-fi actioner is set 200 years in the future. The polar ice caps have melted, flooding the continents and creating a giant ocean. People are few and far between, living as sailors or on rickety atolls made from scrap metal; in this time, dry land is considered a myth and dirt and water have become the most valuable currency. The film begins as a mysterious Mariner aboard his ingenious trimaran urinates carefully into a small jar. He then pours the golden liquid into a filtration device that purifies it and makes it drinkable. The Mariner is self sufficient and eschews humanity, except for occasional stops for supplies. He is different from other humans in that he has developed functional gills and has webbed feet. Such a mutation makes him a pariah. He cruises into a rusty atoll and tries to exchange dirt for supplies. The half-crazy people within the fortress end up putting him in a cage and planning to recycle him in a bubbling vat of green effluvium. Just before he is to die, the fortress is attacked by a flotilla of Smokers (tobacco addicted sea bikers) led by the bald, one-eyed and crazy Deacon who has come to search for a little girl with a strange tattoo on her back that is said to be a map leading to dry land. The girl and her mother escape with the reluctant Mariner. Eventually Deacon and the Smokers capture the girl and it is up to the fishy stranger to save her from their hulking lair (which turns out to be the notorious wreck of the Exxon Valdez)(n)

programme.title: Right at Your Door
programme.desc: Doomsday comes to LA in this gripping tale of terror, panic and paranoia. When dirty bombs are detonated over Southern California, a husband (Rory Cochrane) and his wife (Mary McCormack) become quarantined, he inside their house, she outside. As contaminated ash rains down from the sky, chaos reigns across the area as those left out in the open run the risk of being poisoned by the fatal toxins. The film is the directorial debut of production designer Chris Gorak, who also wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: This intense and unnerving thriller should make viewers' skin crawl. Ashley Judd stars as an Oklahoma waitress who's battling her own addictive demons. She takes on a whole new set of problems when she gets involved with an unhinged Gulf War vet (Michael Shannon) who's wracked with paranoid delusions involving invasive insects and clandestine military experiments. Directed by William Friedkin and written by Tracy Letts, who adapted his stage play. Harry Connick Jr., Lynn Collins(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: In the Far East, Alex O'Connell, the son of famed mummy fighters Rick and Evy O'Connell, unearths the mummy of the first Emperor of Qin -- a shape-shifting entity cursed by a witch centuries ago(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg gives a dynamic performance in the title role, a grieving cop out to avenge the murder of his family. As his investigation evolves he hooks up with an assassin (Mila Kunis), and events take a scary, supernatural turn for the worse. Rapper Ludacris costars with Beau Bridges. Directed by John Moore, the film is based on a popular video game(n)

programme.title: The Abandoned
programme.desc: Director: Nacho Cerdà. An adopted woman returns to her home country and the family home that she never knew and must face the mystery that lies there(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: An experiment to create a girl who is half-human half-alien goes awry when she breaks out of the lab. Sci-fi(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: Comedian Cedric the Entertainer serves as both producer and star of this comedy about a family who discovers just how much can go wrong en route to a family get-together. When Nate Johnson (Cedric the Entertainer) is invited to a big family reunion in Missouri, he sees it as an opportunity to reconnect with his estranged wife and growing children, as well as a chance to show up his wealthier know-it-all brother, Mack (Steve Harvey). Nate takes delivery on an expensive new SUV, persuades his recently separated wife, Dorothy (Vanessa L. Williams), to tag along, and packs up his three kids -- nubile teenager Nikki (Solange Knowles), under-age wannabe rapper D.J. (Bow Wow), and precocious seven-year-old Destiny (Gabby Soleil) -- for what he imagines will be a leisurely drive from Los Angeles to St. Louis. However, between his wary wife, arguing kids, angry police officers, bizarre hitchhikers, bad diner food, and an unfortunate run-in with a cement mixer, getting from point A to point B proves to be just short of a nightmare. Johnson Family Vacation was the first feature film for director Christopher Erskin, who previously distinguished himself directing music videos for the likes of Missy Elliot, TLC, and Boyz II Men(n)

programme.title: The Dead Pool
programme.desc: Thriller in which maverick cop Lt Harry Callahan (Clint Eastwood) investigates a series of brutal murders linked to a macabre gambling game which predicts the death of certain celebrities. The case hots up when Callahan's own name appears on the lethal line-up(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Intriguing horror thriller based on Richard Matheson's novel about a man who, after being hypnotized, starts seeing haunting visions of a girl that won't stop until he finds out what happened to her(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Scientist Bruce Banner (Edward Norton) have been living in shadows, seeking a cure to his unique condition, which causes him to turn into The Incredible Hulk, a giant green monster, under emotional stress. But the military forces who dream of abusing his powers won't leave him alone. Upon returning to civilization, Banner is ruthlessly pursued by a nightmarish beast whose powers match The Hulk's own. A fight of comic-book proportions ensues as Banner must call upon the hero within to rescue New York City from total destruction(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Gripping epic, set just prior to WWII, bursts at the seams with charismatic star turns by Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman. She's a prim English aristocrat who returns to Australia to claim an inherited ranch, and he's a rugged drover who helps her battle wealthy land-grabbers trying to steal it from her. To make matters worse, the Japanese are threatening to invade the continent. Bryan Brown, Jack Thompson, Essie Davis, Brandon Walters. Produced, cowritten and directed by Baz Luhrmann(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: Con artists Will and Jake Grimm encounter a genuine fairy-tale curse that requires more than their usual fakery(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: A young couple staying at a remote holiday spot are terrorized by masked intruders(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul WS Anderson tunes-up Roger Corman's 1975 cult vehicle "Death Race 2000" in this action flick about a contest pitting a convict against other convicts, with the winner walking off with his freedom(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Frustrated corporate analyst Wesley Gibson finds out that the father who abandoned him as a child was actually a professional killer who belonged to an ancient organization called The Fraternity, and he has just been murdered. Sexy assassin Fox (Angelina Jolie) brings him into the organization, where he learns that he shares his father's superhuman killing abilities. As he gets ready to face a dangerous enemy, he begins to suspect things may not be what they seem(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant (Frank Grillo) who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate (Elizabeth Mitchell) who wants to end "the Purge." Written and directed by James DeMonaco(n)

programme.title: I (Almost) Got Away With It
programme.sub-title: Got a Country Legend's Tour Bus
programme.desc: Got a Country Legend's Tour Bus. Christopher is wanted for petty theft and known for his choice of getaway vehicles. But this time the cops have resolved to capture him for good(n)

programme.title: Weaponology
programme.desc: Fire Weapons. The cable documentary series Weaponology investigates the science of warfare as it has progressed and developed - over the centuries - from crude battlefield contraptions to diabolically inventive stealth weaponry. Each episode hones in on one particular category of weapon and discusses its background, evolution and strategic employment on the front lines. Episode Eleven, "Fire Weapons," explores implements of attack that are fueled by fire - from the maritime use of fire to destroy seacraft in Ancient Greece, to the deadly prevalence of napalm in the Vietnam war and the thermobaric destruction of present-day bombs(n)

programme.title: Weaponology
programme.desc: Rapid Fire. The cable documentary series Weaponology investigates the science of warfare as it has progressed and developed - over the centuries - from crude battlefield contraptions to diabolically inventive weaponry. Each episode hones in on one particular category of weapon and discusses its background, evolution and strategic employment on the front lines. Episode three, "Rapid Fire," traces one of the deadliest of all wartime developments: the use of weapons that can fire continuously, from the stationary Gatling guns of the 19th century to the terrifying subatomic machine guns of the present day(n)

programme.desc: Air Force to Air Power. The monoplane; England's development of an air-defense system; the construction of bombers; the invention of the bombsight(n)

programme.title: Warplane

programme.title: Warplane
programme.desc: Age of Stealth. A look at the stealth age includes the U-2 spy plane; the invention of flight-control computers; and fly-by-wire technology(n)

programme.desc: Expansion. The camp is expanded under the command of Rudolf Höss to accommodate greater numbers of prisoners(n)

programme.title: Auschwitz: Hitler's Final Solution
programme.desc: Deportation. European ghettos are emptied as thousands of Jews are transported to Auschwitz by rail, and many are sent straight to the gas chambers if they are deemed unfit to work(n)

programme.title: Auschwitz: Hitler's Final Solution
programme.desc: Exploitation. Corruption and crimes at Auschwitz, including the theft of valuables by SS guards, camp brothels and Dr. Josef Mengele's human experiments, are chronicled(n)

programme.title: Auschwitz: Hitler's Final Solution
programme.desc: Devastation. The Allies learn of the camp by 1944, but decide not to bomb the rail lines leading to it, and Jews from Nazi-occupied territories continue to arrive(n)

programme.title: Auschwitz: Hitler's Final Solution

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and musician Bill Bailey joins host Michel Roux Jr to sample dishes prepared in the studio by chocolatier William Curley and Chinese cookery expert Ching He Huang.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge joins host Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to reveal how the consumer can spend less on food without sacrificing flavour, creating a mouth-watering meal using breast of lamb for just £2 a head. Drinks expert Kate Goodman reveals the hidden costs in bargain basement bottles of booze, while comedienne and actress Arabella Weir argues that eating well is not an option for the poorest in society.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two wild swimmers go up against a pair of lifeguards in Builth Wells, with the assistance of Caroline Hawley and Colin Young. Meanwhile, presenter Tim Wonnacott goes on a social history trip, and is flummoxed by an interesting find at the fair.(n)

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The AEGON Championships. Sue Barker introduces coverage of the sixth day of the famous grass-court tournament at Queen's Club, featuring the men's singles semi-finals. Defending champion Andy Murray was pushed all the way in his match against Marin Cilic at this stage last year, as he eventually prevailed 6-3, 4-6, 6-3, while Milos Raonic defeated Bernard Tomic 6-4, 6-4. With commentary by Andrew Castle, Andrew Cotter, John Lloyd and Peter Fleming, and reports from John Inverdale. Coverage continues on BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present as another selection of celebrities take part in the general knowledge quiz. This time, the duo open the contest to famous faces who made a name for themselves early in life. Outnumbered's Tyger Drew-Honey teams up with This Is England's Thomas Turgoose, while Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory's Julie Dawn Cole joins forces with Oliver! star Mark Lester. Plus, former Grange Hill stars Lee MacDonald and Erkan Mustafa take on old classmate Michelle Gayle as she partners ex-Coronation Street actor Adam Rickitt.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Friendship drives the Doctor to make the rashest decision of his many lives when, trapped on board a giant spaceship, caught in the event horizon of a black hole, he witnesses the death of someone he pledged to protect. For a man well-accustomed to bending the laws of time to his advantage, now every passing second seems to be leading to an awful loss beyond even his control. However, he remains determined to overcome the odds and redeem his mistake, but prevailing against time itself could be one battle too many for the Time Lord. Sci-fi adventure, starring Peter Capaldi, Pearl Mackie, Matt Lucas and Michelle Gomez.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Battle
programme.desc: The choral music contest continues, as Mel Giedroyc gives another diverse selection of choirs a chance to compete in head-to-head knock-out challenges. This week's entrants are all-female pop choir The City Academy Songbirds, a group of soul singers Soul Train, Scot Soul, a group of five childhood friends from Loch Lomond, YouTube a cappella sensations Out of the Blue, Rat Pack-inspired quartet The Flyboys and pop choir The Noteables. Chaka Khan takes a seat on the panel, to help resident judges Gareth Malone and Kelis to deliver their expert opinions on each performance.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Alicia's concerns about Ethan escalate when she discovers he hasn't been sleeping, and has instead been keeping watch outside of Scott Ellisson's flat. Elsewhere, Iain and Lily begin the day with a spring in their step after their night together, but cracks begin to show in their blossoming relationship when they disagree over how to deal with an elderly couple hospitalised following a botched suicide pact. Plus, sparks fly between Connie and Sam.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Cathy goes to extreme lengths to impress her psychologist boyfriend, much to Agnes's disgust, while Rory locates the perfect apartment for him and Dino - the problem is, it's in Kilbride, meaning he'll have to learn to drive. Mark prepares to emigrate to Australia. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll as the foul-mouthed mother-of-six.(n)

programme.title: The Proposal
programme.desc: A Canadian publishing editor working in New York faces deportation to her own country. Desperate to stay in America, she offers her assistant a promotion if he will marry her, but an immigration official becomes suspicious and the pair are forced to go to desperate lengths to look like a happy couple. Romantic comedy, starring Sandra Bullock and Ryan Reynolds.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Emma Barnett and Sean Fletcher present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross and Charles Hanson lead two teams competing at Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, while presenter Tim Wonnacott observes which side raises the greater profit before spotting something that sends him potty.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in Port Talbot, Wimbledon and Telford.(n)

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The AEGON Championships. Sue Barker introduces coverage of the men's singles final at Queen's Club, on the seventh day of the famous grass-court tournament. Defending champion Andy Murray claimed this title for the fifth time in his career when he defeated Milos Raonic 6-7, 6-4, 6-3 in the showpiece match last year, which saw him become the most successful player here in the open era. With commentary by Andrew Castle, Andrew Cotter, John Lloyd and Peter Fleming, and reports from John Inverdale.(n)

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine presents a selection of viewers' comments on BBC shows, a chance to see memorable clips, and an insight into what goes on behind the scenes of new programmes.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: David Grant travels along the Settle to Carlisle railway, and uncovering the stories of the workers who risked their lives to build the Ribblehead Viaduct.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys tests the comedian Shappi Khorsandi on Charlie Chaplin, Radio One's Chris Stark on Scott Mills, The House £100k Built presenter Piers Taylor on Bob Dylan, and the Paralympian gold medallist - and opening ceremony flag-bearer - Lee Pearson on British birds.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher reports from Carmarthenshire, where he meets an expert on birds of prey in Carmarthenshire who uses drones designed to look like birds to train falcons to hunt. He takes a look behind the scenes in the workshop where they are built and visits a breeding unit for peregrine falcon chicks. Plus, a selection of reports from the series featuring working animals.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the Lake District. Items brought in to be valued include a rare collection of signed Beatrix Potter first editions belonging to descendants of the author's solicitor, a desk that belonged to the last Russian tsar which was bought following the revolution, some Edwardian weightlifting equipment and a set of over 100 vintage firefighters' helmets.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: Ross is ordered to leave Roscoff under threat of execution. He travels with Tholly to meet his contact in France, but finds information about Dwight's fate comes at a high price. Sam leads a congregation of methodists in protest outside the church - only to face broken promises from George, who revokes their lease on the meeting house, which leads them to turn to Elizabeth for help. Geoffrey Charles has some words of advice for Drake, who has shared a moment of intimacy on the beach with Morwenna.(n)

programme.title: Tracey Breaks the News
programme.desc: Tracey Ullman returns with a one-off political and topical offering, filmed close to transmission and broadcast in the aftermath of the general election. For the first time Tracey is taking on an impression of Theresa May, alongside favourites Angela Merkel and Nicola Sturgeon. The show features a mix of famous political figures and everyday people reacting to the election results and the anniversary of the Brexit vote. As the election result will have global implications, the show also looks at the reaction of the Russians, Europeans and - Melania Trump.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Eddie Izzard, Josh Widdicombe and Trevor Noah.
programme.desc: Eddie Izzard hosts an evening of stand-up at the Apollo in Hammersmith, London, treating the audience to his own brand of stream-of-consciousness humour before introducing routines by The Last Leg star Josh Widdicombe and South African comic Trevor Noah.(n)

programme.title: The Spectacular Now
programme.desc: A teenage loner wakes up one morning to find a classmate passed out drunk on her lawn. They form an unlikely friendship, and he offers her help in constructing a new persona for herself that will boost her confidence - but begins to fall in love with the act she is putting on. Drama based on the novel by Tim Tharp, starring Miles Teller, Shailene Woodley and Brie Larson.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Love Affair
programme.desc: Two strangers have a whirlwind romance on a cruise, despite being engaged to other people. They decide to wait to see if their feelings change before leaving their partners, and agree to meet at the Empire State Building in six months if they choose to be together. However, when the date arrives, a tragic accident keeps them apart. Romantic drama, starring Charles Boyer and Irene Dunne.(n)

programme.title: Odette
programme.desc: The French widow of an English soldier offers her services to British Intelligence, and is sent undercover as a spy in Nazi-occupied France. However, her work alongside the resistance leads to her falling into the clutches of the Gestapo. Fact-based Second World War drama, with Anna Neagle, Trevor Howard, Peter Ustinov and Marius Goring.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Irish Escape
programme.desc: Monty takes to the water to electronically tag the fins of basking sharks off the West Coast of Ireland so their movements can be tracked by scientists. Back onshore, his self-sufficiency efforts are sabotaged by otters that raid his lobster creels, and his dog Reuben, which accidentally savages him while he is out winkle picking.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in Port Talbot, Wimbledon and Telford.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The first of the Northern Ireland heats sees returning contender Eddie Attwell and newcomers Joery Castel and Tommy Heaney prepare their starters for the banquet. Eddie is using a number of modern techniques, Joery hopes to impress with a tribute to 1996 Wimbledon champion Richard Krajicek, while Tommy creates a warm salad. Who will win the favour of the veteran judge?.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Northern Ireland chefs prepare their seafood courses as they try to win a place at the Taste of Summer banquet honouring 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. Joery Castel combines mackerel and cucumber in his dish, Tommy Heaney hopes his Murray Mound is a fitting tribute to Andy Murray's apparent love of sushi and Eddie Attwell creates five different strawberry elements to accompany the scallops in his effort.(n)

programme.title: Splash
programme.desc: A lonely New Yorker is rescued from drowning by a mermaid, who falls in love with him and assumes human form so she can seek him out in Manhattan. He is soon equally smitten, and she resolves to keep her true nature a secret from him. However, an obsessive scientist suspects the truth and plans to prove it. Romantic fantasy comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Daryl Hannah and John Candy.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson goes property hunting in rural Wiltshire with a couple who have £950,000 to buy a family home with land, where they and their young children can enjoy a self-sufficient lifestyle. Jules also takes time out to find out about the county's glove-making heritage and sees some famous examples made for famous figures.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a tree fern in the damp garden and uses netting to protect his soft fruits from birds. Carol Klein selects hardy geraniums as her Plant of the Month, Flo Headlam visits an inspiring church garden in Lewisham that feeds both the mind and body, and Nick Bailey gets an insight into the impact of parasitoid wasps on gardens. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Anita Manning and James Lewis value antiques and collectibles at Balbirnie House in Fife, including a Moorcroft pin dish and a Troika vase, before a selection are sold at auction in Edinburgh. Presenter Paul Martin also visits Falkland Palace.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Nick Grimshaw begin the BBC's TV coverage of the second day of the annual music festival in Somerset, with performances by Jools Holland and Craig David.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Cameraman Charlie Hamilton James has been captivated by otters for the last 25 years and has filmed them more than anyone else. Now, through the eyes of three river orphaned otters, he sets out to reveal their survival secrets and exactly why he believes these creatures are so special.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Nick Grimshaw present highlights from the Pyramid Stage, where pop starlet Katy Perry makes her debut Glastonbury appearance today. Plus, the best performances from across the festival ground throughout the second day, and another selection of bespoke acoustic music.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Jo Whiley present live, uninterrupted coverage of this evening's headline set by Foo Fighters. Fans and attendees will both be hoping frontman Dave Grohl will be taking good care of himself before travelling to Worthy Farm this weekend; he and his band were due to perform as a headline act at the 2015 festival, but were forced to pull out after Grohl broke his leg during an on-stage stunt at a concert in Sweden. Beyond the US rockers' set, Lauren Laverne and Huw Stephens will be touring the festival grounds to take in a few more acoustic performances.(n)

programme.title: Goodbye First Love
programme.desc: A teenage girl falls in love with an older boy, but is devastated when he leaves her to travel the world. As an adult, she finally forms a successful relationship with a man after years of wariness, but their happiness is threatened when her first love returns. Romantic drama, with Lola Creton and Sebastian Urzendowsky. In French, German and Danish.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter S, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Return of the programme in which presenter Helen Skelton and designer Danny Clarke transform unloved gardens in a single day, beginning with a back garden suffering from the after effects of flooding in York.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a tree fern in the damp garden and uses netting to protect his soft fruits from birds. Carol Klein selects hardy geraniums as her Plant of the Month, Flo Headlam visits an inspiring church garden in Lewisham that feeds both the mind and body, and Nick Bailey gets an insight into the impact of parasitoid wasps on gardens. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Jim McColl sees how his favourite cutting flowers are getting on and adds an easy staking system to keep the heads up, and Brian Cunningham experiments with a range of slow-growing, small-leaved evergreens as alternatives to box plants. Carole Baxter visits a couple in Dunblane, Stirling, who have created their garden from scratch over the past eight years.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison and Sean Fletcher present the show from the Hay Festival, where they meet the event's organisers as well as writers and artists. Ellie also goes on a wildlife safari inspired by one of the featured books and joins a team spotting and tracking adders with radio transmitters. Plus, Adam Henson reports on technology for preventing droughts and John Craven presents an update on the Countryfile Photographic Competition.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Northern Ireland, Tommy Heaney, Joery Castel and Eddie Attwell, go all out to impress with their main courses. Barbecued dishes are on the menu for two of the chefs, with Tommy creating a surf and turf combination, while Joery aims to recreate a more American style barbecue, and Eddie opts for an unusual meat, water buffalo, for the centrepiece of his main course.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Northern Ireland chefs Eddie Attwell, Tommy Heaney and Joery Castel prepare their desserts, knowing this is the last chance to impress before one of them has to leave the competition. Two of them attempt technical dishes featuring edible chocolate tennis balls, while the third cooks a traditional Dutch pancake. Which two will make it through to tomorrow?.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest-scoring chefs from Northern Ireland cook for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver, who are joined by tennis player Mansour Bahrami as guest judge. Only one contender can be chosen to represent the region in the national finals, taking them a step closer to cooking at the Wimbledon Championships.(n)

programme.title: Sailing
programme.sub-title: Sailing: America's Cup Highlights: 2017 Races Five and Six.
programme.desc: Shirley Robertson presents action from races five and six of the prestigious event in Bermuda, as Oracle Team USA look to triumph for the third successive occasion.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and her team transforms and sells mirrors, a wardrobe and kitchen scales about to be dumped at an Altrincham tip, before giving the profits to the owners.(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich Brothers compete to design a garden for a family of seven in Stamford, Lincolnshire, who have just moved from rural Rutland and miss the countryside. With five noisy children, the parents want a peaceful garden that they can call their own, but the awkward plot gives the presenters a huge challenge, despite a budget of £4,500.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple look for a property with business potential in the Yorkshire Dales, and also learns the art of barrel-making from Britain's only master cooper.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The story of a giant otter cub rescued and raised by Brazilian naturalist Carolina Vargas. The creature has to be bottle fed, learn how to hunt fish and be taught how to survive the predators of the world's largest wetland, the Pantanal in South America.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents as people are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction. In this episode, Michael Baggott and Kate Bateman are at Dulwich College in south-east London, where they value items including a Steiff monkey and a silver Russian goblet. Meanwhile, Paul Martin also visits St Paul's Cathedral, learning about Christopher Wren's design.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe and Lauren Laverne present coverage of the afternoon's highlights, including the Bee Gee and classic songwriter Barry Gibb's performance at the Sunday Afternoon Legends slot. Plus, Nile Rodgers and his disco band Chic perform many of their hits at the Pyramid Stage, alongside a selection of acoustic sets from throughout the day, live reports from around the site, and a look forward to the final headliner, pop star Ed Sheeran.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Huw Stephens present live coverage of global pop star Ed Sheeran's performance at the Pyramid Stage on the third and final night of coverage from the festival at Worthy Farm, marking the singer's debut as a Glastonbury headliner. Following Ed Sheeran's live performance, Jo Whiley, Mark Radcliffe and Huw Stephens take over the presenting reins on the BBC Two sofa and reminisce on the best of the final day of the festival, looking back at their own personal highlights from across the weekend. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.sub-title: Toots & The Maytals & Liam Gallagher at Glastonbury 2017.
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe and Alice Levine begin BBC Four's Glastonbury coverage today with highlights from this afternoon's sets by Jamaican group Toots & the Maytals and Liam Gallagher.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Alice Levine and Mark Radcliffe continue to provide live coverage from Worthy Farm, as the Brooklyn-based US indie-rockers The National perform at the Pyramid Stage this evening.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe and Alice Levine present live coverage from the John Peel Stage, where the American singer-songwriter Father John Misty is performing this evening.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.desc: Further live coverage of this evening's performances on the West Holts stage, as the veteran funk-pop family band The Jacksons play their evening set.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: An edition of the long-running music show, featuring studio performances and videos from acts in the Top 40 singles chart.(n)

programme.title: Northern Soul: Living for the Weekend
programme.desc: A look at the rise, fall and rebirth of the music and dance movement that took place across the north of England during the 1970s. Archive footage and vivid first-hand accounts reveal the dynamic culture of fashions, dance moves and musical obsessions that were all fuelled by a unique style of black American soul music based on heavy beats. With contributions by Richard Searling, Ian Levine, Colin Kurtis, Kev Roberts, Pete Waterman, Peter Stringfellow and others.(n)

programme.title: Classic Soul at the BBC
programme.desc: Performances from the BBC archive by acclaimed soul singers, including Aretha Franklin, Al Green, Isaac Hayes, Dusty Springfield, Solomon Burke and Percy Sledge.(n)

programme.title: Otis Redding: Soul Ambassador
programme.desc: Profile of the soul singer, documenting his childhood and career, including unseen home movies that reveal how his 1967 tour of Britain dramatically changed his life and music. Plus, footage of rare performances and intimate interviews with Redding's widow, daughter and previous band members Steve Cropper and Booker T Jones, as well as celebrity fans Rod Stewart, Tom Jones and Bryan Ferry.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
programme.sub-title: Rag'n'Bone Man and Shaggy at Glastonbury 2017.
programme.desc: Alice Levine introduces coverage of singer-songwriter Rag'n'Bone Man's debut performance at the festival from the Other Stage, followed by reggae star Shaggy's appearance at the West Holts Stage.(n)

programme.title: Glastonbury 2017
