programme.title: Stargate
programme.desc: Two travelers discover a new ecosphere through an prehistoric Egyptian relic(n)

programme.title: Patton
programme.desc: Profile of military genius Gen. George S. Patton and chronicles his World War II campaigns on the European front and in North Africa, and his push into Germany(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: A wild and star-studded parody of 'Star Wars', in which the fair Princess Vespa must be rescued from the malevolent clutches of arch-villain Lord Dark Helmet, giving rise to a series of heroic escapades(n)

programme.title: Hancock
programme.desc: Academy Award(r) nominee Will Smith, Academy Award(r) winner Charlize Theron and Jason Bateman star in this fast paced action drama about a tortured superhero who crash-lands in Sheepshead Bay, Brooklyn, and tries to revitalise himself by romancing an alluring housewife, causing chaos in the city. Well-intentioned but hard-living, edgy, sarcastic and misunderstood, Hancock is not your everyday superhero. His heroics, while they might get the job done and save lives, always seem to leave jaw-dropping damage in their wake. Having fallen out of favour with the public, things don't look good for Hancock - until he saves the life of a PR executive(n)

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: When aliens mistake images of 1980s arcade games as a sign of aggression, they attack Earth with evil versions of Pac-Man, Donkey Kong and other video-game characters. In response, the U.S. president (Kevin James) asks his old gamer pals (Adam Sandler, Josh Gad, and Peter Dinklage) to battle the invaders(n)

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Stanley Kubrick's masterful black comedy about Cold War paranoia and world annihilation. Peter Sellers plays three roles in a career-best performance(n)

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: John Candy stars in John Hughes' big-hearted comedy as the eponymous oaf who has to babysit his brother's kids: difficult teenager Tia, cute little Maizy, and the perpetually inquisitive Miles. Candy's trademark grown-up-who-never-grew-up act provides the perfect launch pad for domestic chaos and some cracking exchanges, topped by Miles' quickfire interrogation about Buck's personal life(n)

programme.title: Because I Said So
programme.desc: Diane Keaton and Mandy Moore star in this romcom from director Michael Lehmann (The Truth About Cats & Dogs). Daphne Wilder is worried about her youngest daughter, Milly. Not only is she still unwed, but, with a string of not even remotely successful love affairs behind her, it's starting to look as though she'll stay that way. So what's a mother to do? Well, what about seeking out and vetting potential suitors for her daughter via the internet? And thus Daphne sets in train the inevitable series of misunderstandings that may or may not lead to Milly getting together with the man who looks most likely to be her Mr Right, musician Johnny; unless, of course, Mr Right turns out to be architect Jason(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: Waking from a coma, a female contract killer wreaks revenge on the assassins who tried to kill her(n)

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: A wild and star-studded parody of 'Star Wars', in which the fair Princess Vespa must be rescued from the malevolent clutches of arch-villain Lord Dark Helmet, giving rise to a series of heroic escapades(n)

programme.title: The Good Shepherd
programme.desc: A bright student's life is dramatically changed when he is invited to join Skull and Bones, Yale University's powerful secret society. The next 30 years are filled with espionage, secrets and scandal, and the ultimate evolution of the CIA(n)

programme.title: Pixels
programme.desc: When aliens mistake images of 1980s arcade games as a sign of aggression, they attack Earth with evil versions of Pac-Man, Donkey Kong and other video-game characters. In response, the U.S. president (Kevin James) asks his old gamer pals (Adam Sandler, Josh Gad, and Peter Dinklage) to battle the invaders(n)

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Stanley Kubrick's masterful black comedy about Cold War paranoia and world annihilation. Peter Sellers plays three roles in a career-best performance(n)

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: A year after their car hit a stranger, four teenagers are being stalked by someone(n)

programme.title: The Good Shepherd
programme.desc: A bright student's life is dramatically changed when he is invited to join Skull and Bones, Yale University's powerful secret society. The next 30 years are filled with espionage, secrets and scandal, and the ultimate evolution of the CIA(n)

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: Set just three decades into the future, Alex Proyas's all-action science-fiction film is inspired by Isaac Asimov's 1950s short story. The science of robotics is so advanced that humanoid-looking servants have been developed, ready to obey any command from a human. When the chief designer of US Robotics, the biggest manufacturer of this new brand, is found dead in the company's atrium after a fall from the upper floor, it has all the hallmarks of suicide, and Chicago cop Del Spooner is assigned to the case. But technophobe Spooner doesn't believe that all robots are harmless. Despite opposition from both his superiors and the company, he investigates further and soon his suspicions centre on one robot, Sonny. Is 'he' one of an army of conscious, violent robots ready to challenge their human masters?(n)

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More
programme.desc: Two rival bounty hunters unite to track a sadistic outlaw, and fight for survival in the desert(n)

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's terrifying masterpiece about a coastal community plagued by a killer shark. With the summer tourist season at hand, the mayor is keen to keep the first attack hushed up. But when an expert claims that the attacks are the work of a giant Great White, there is only one solution - to kill the monster fish before it can feed again. Based on Peter Benchley's best-seller, three sequels and numerous imitators followed. Steven Spielberg(n)

programme.title: Jaws 2
programme.desc: Having recovered from the grisly events of four years ago, Amity Island is once again packed with tourists. Families are sailing in the bay and swimming off the beach, but when two divers and a water-skier go missing, the local police chief fears that he is about to relive his greatest nightmare(n)

programme.title: Jaws 3
programme.desc: A Great White shark menaces an outdoor water park that employs the grown son of a small-town police-officer who helped kill a shark that had been threatening their home town(n)

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge
programme.desc: After her younger son is killed in the water, the widow of the man who killed the first Amity great white shark begins to believe her entire family is targeted by a monster of the deep. She heads for the Bahamas to warn her other son, a marine biologist, unaware that she is being followed by a large, hungry shark intent on revenge(n)

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: In this thrilling and feminist Western, four prostitutes must flee their brothel after one of them murders a colonel who tried to rape a fellow working girl. Later, the women reinvent themselves as gunslinging vigilantes(n)

programme.title: Moulin Rouge
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman and Ewan McGregor star in this tale of a love affair set against the backdrop of the fantastical world of Paris nightlife(n)

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: A starry-eyed would-be star discovers just how far the notion that "there's no such thing as bad publicity" can go in this screen adaptation of the hit Broadway musical +Chicago, originally directed and choreographed by Bob Fosse. In the mid-'20s, Roxie Hart (Renee Zellweger) is a small-time chorus dancer married to a well-meaning dunderhead named Amos (John C. Reilly). Roxie is having an affair on the side with Fred Casley (Dominic West), a smooth talker who insists he can make her a star. However, Fred strings Roxie along a bit too far for his own good, and when she realizes that his promises are empty, she becomes enraged and murders Fred in cold blood. Roxie soon finds herself behind bars alongside Velma Kelly (Catherine Zeta-Jones), a sexy vaudeville star who used to perform with her sister until Velma discovered that her sister had been sleeping with her husband. Velma shot them both dead, and, after scheming prison matron "Mama" Morton hooks Velma up with hotshot lawyer Billy Flynn (Richard Gere), Velma becomes the new Queen of the scandal sheets. Roxie is just shrewd enough to realize that her poor fortune could also bring her fame, so she convinces Amos to also hire Flynn. Soon Flynn is splashing Roxie's story -- or, more accurately, a highly melodramatic revision of Roxie's story -- all over the gutter press, and Roxy and Velma are soon battling neck-to-neck over who can win greater fame through the headlines. A project that had been moving from studio to studio since the musical opened on Broadway in 1973, Chicago also features guest appearances by Lucy Liu and Christine Baranski(n)

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: Anarchic, nihilistic satire on modern life in which an office worker who feels emotionally deadened by his consumerist lifestyle has a chance encounter with a charismatic man. Finding that they are kindred spirits, the two men start up a no-holds-barred bare-knuckle fighting club, with the aim of making its members feel 'alive' once again. Based on Chuck Palahniuk's novel(n)

programme.title: Best of the Best 3: No Turning Back
programme.desc: The action series continues, as Tommy Lee takes on a group of neo-Nazis in the American heartland(n)

programme.title: Kickboxer 5: The Redemption
programme.desc: Living up to its tagline, "Payback can be deadly," this installment in the popular-on-video Kickboxer series follows the travails of a displaced fighter out to avenge his friend's death. Stepping in for former hero Sasha Mitchell -- who in turn stepped in for original Kickboxer Jean-Claude Van Damme -- is Mark Dacascos, playing Matt Reeves, the longtime buddy of David Sloan (formerly Mitchell, here played by an uncredited actor). When he finds out that Sloan was murdered after refusing to join a nefarious boxing organization, Reeves travels to South Africa to get Bollen (Greg Latter), the evil leader of the cult-like federation. Redemption: Kickboxer 5 was given the "Redemption" prefix upon its 2003 video release(n)

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: In this riveting thriller, an assassination attempt is made on the president in front of a crowd, but no two witnesses can agree on who did what to whom. A Secret Service agent (Dennis Quaid) must race against time to uncover the shocking truth before the conspirators escape. Matthew Fox, Sigourney Weaver, Forest Whitaker, William Hurt(n)

programme.title: Navy SEALs
programme.desc: Rousing action drama in which an elite US Navy commando force is sent to rescue hostages from a ship in the Middle East. A plot is uncovered to sell stolen Stinger missiles to terrorists, but when the SEALS launch a surprise attack in Syria to retrieve the armaments, the terrorists become more aggressive and the mission more dangerous, culminating in an invasion of besieged Beirut(n)

programme.title: Bloodsport
programme.desc: American special forces commando Jean-Claude Van Damme goes AWOL to compete in the Kumite, a clandestine martial arts contest held in Hong Kong(n)

programme.title: The Big Boss
programme.desc: A man is sent from his rural home to work in a tough ice factory. He has sworn an oath to avoid violence, but a series of sinister events tests his character. He soon discovers his boss is embroiled in underworld dealings with dastardly heroin smugglers - and sets out to deliver his own brand of justice(n)

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: Anarchic, nihilistic satire on modern life in which an office worker who feels emotionally deadened by his consumerist lifestyle has a chance encounter with a charismatic man. Finding that they are kindred spirits, the two men start up a no-holds-barred bare-knuckle fighting club, with the aim of making its members feel 'alive' once again. Based on Chuck Palahniuk's novel(n)

programme.title: Desperate Measures
programme.desc: With a gravely ill son in need of a bone marrow transplant, detective Andy Garcia's only hope is to capture alive an escaped killer (Michael Keaton) who is a perfect DNA match(n)

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: In this riveting thriller, an assassination attempt is made on the president in front of a crowd, but no two witnesses can agree on who did what to whom. A Secret Service agent (Dennis Quaid) must race against time to uncover the shocking truth before the conspirators escape. Matthew Fox, Sigourney Weaver, Forest Whitaker, William Hurt(n)

programme.title: The Big Boss
programme.desc: A man is sent from his rural home to work in a tough ice factory. He has sworn an oath to avoid violence, but a series of sinister events tests his character. He soon discovers his boss is embroiled in underworld dealings with dastardly heroin smugglers - and sets out to deliver his own brand of justice(n)

programme.title: Bloodsport
programme.desc: American special forces commando Jean-Claude Van Damme goes AWOL to compete in the Kumite, a clandestine martial arts contest held in Hong Kong(n)

programme.title: John Carpenter's Vampires
programme.desc: By night vampires rise from loamy graves in search of human prey. By day vampire slayer Jack Crow leads a contingent of Vatican mercenaries in a long-waged war against these enemies. After destroying a vampire nest in rural New Mexico, "Team Crow" is savagely ambushed during the victory celebration by the unholy Valek, a vicious 600 year old vampire. Valek is nearing the end of a long search for the elusive Berziers Cross, the implement of ritual that can give him and all vampires succeeding him omnipotent power to walk in the daylight(n)

programme.title: Death Wish
programme.desc: When a vicious gang rape and murder his wife and leave his daughter catatonic, a previously liberal-minded man decides to take the law into his own hands, becoming a vigilante(n)

programme.title: The Anomaly
programme.desc: Noel Clarke stars as an ex-soldier who must fight to discover why he is only conscious for bursts of nine minutes and 47 seconds(n)

programme.title: The Big Boss
programme.desc: A man is sent from his rural home to work in a tough ice factory. He has sworn an oath to avoid violence, but a series of sinister events tests his character. He soon discovers his boss is embroiled in underworld dealings with dastardly heroin smugglers - and sets out to deliver his own brand of justice(n)

programme.title: John Ford Goes to War
programme.desc: In this documentary centered on legendary filmmaker John Ford's cinematic contributions to Allied morale during World War II, actor/musician Kris Kristofferson narrates as the How Green Was My Valley director turns his back on Tinseltown in order to fulfill his patriotic duty. By the time the United States became involved in World War II, John Ford was already a film legend, but when Uncle Sam came calling the veteran filmmaker eagerly packed his bags and set his sites on the frontlines. Though Ford did sustain battlefield injuries during the production of the Oscar-winning documentary The Battle of Midway, the remarkable film endeared him to patriotic American audiences across the country and his next wartime effort, 1943's December 7th, proceeded to earn the filmmaker yet another Oscar. In addition to featuring footage from these and other, lesser-known wartime films from Ford, this documentary also offers an intimate look at the complex filmmaker and explores his remarkable legacy through both archive footage and interviews with such notable directors as Oliver Stone and Peter Bogdanovich(n)

programme.title: Wolf Totem
programme.desc: A student from 1960's Beijing discovers a common ground between himself and the animals he lives beside in this period drama from director Jean-Jacques Annaud. After being sent to Mongolia to live with a group of herdsmen, Chen Zhen (Feng Shaofeng) develops an affection for a group of wolves who he comes to see as equals, and attempts to adopt and raise an endangered cub(n)

programme.title: The Package
programme.desc: A Seattle mob enforcer must deliver a mysterious package to a former rival, but he finds himself pursued by killers, mercenaries and maniacs while attempting to get the job done(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police in Pierce County, Washington, respond to a call about a belligerent tow-truck operator, while officers in Las Vegas provide backup during a not-so-routine traffic violation.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police in California chase a driver who refused to stop following a hit-and-run, and officers in Amarillo, Texas, try to stop a belligerent drunk causing trouble in a hotel lobby.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Returning from a six-month posting in the Gulf, Navy lieutenant commander Megan Huffner opens her front door to find her husband Noel dead in his chair. Gibbs and the team investigate and find the victim died three or four weeks earlier, and an unusual $100 bill in his wallet proves to be a vital clue. Meanwhile, Tony's father visits for Christmas and looks to rebuild their fractured relationship. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man and his son on a fishing trip hook what appears to be the body of a petty officer, but the dead man turns out to be a journalist who had been investigating the proliferation of drugs in the Navy. Meanwhile, Ziva returns to her car after a workout at the gym to find her father Eli hiding inside. Guest starring Michael Nouri.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Conclusion. After the deaths of two family members of NCIS employees, the team identifies the killer as a Swedish mercenary and the ballistics report reveals the bullets came from an Iranian arms dealer. McGee traces a wire transfer made to the hitman's ex-wife and son to an account under the name Virtue, and Ziva makes a connection after realising what the Hebrew translation is.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called to the scene of a fatal car crash involving marine lance corporal Chad Dunn and student Lyla Cutwright. Duckie notices that the woman's injuries do not match the specifics of the accident and there are no skidmarks found at the scene, leading Gibbs to declare they possibly have a murder and a suicide on their hands. Abby calls in sick for the first time after the case stirs up a traumatic incident from her childhood. Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team capture computer hacker Ajay Khan, who was recently responsible for hacking into NCIS's supposedly ultra-secure multiple-threat alert centre. They believe he could hold the key to tracking down the most-wanted cyber terrorist in the world, who may be plotting an attack using a bomb containing a strain of the Ebola virus. When Khan refuses to co-operate, Ziva and DiNozzo take him to Guantanamo Bay to be placed with people he had previously betrayed. Guest starring Vik Sahay (Chuck).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs, McGee and Torres travel to a remote area of Paraguay controlled by violent rebels, in search of a Navy Seal who disappeared during an unsanctioned trip. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The American naval crime drama returns, joined by a new recruit played by Jennifer Esposito. The team investigates a deadly car explosion in DC that seems to be connected to Special Agent Nick Torres's disappearance six months earlier, while on a deep-cover operation in Argentina.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The disappearance of a federal judge's daughter on the same day as her grandmother dies leads the team to the family's guarded home, where security officers insist the girl never left the property. Convinced she was murdered, Jane searches for the body and concludes the victim was placed in her relative's coffin - prompting him to test his theory on the day of the funeral. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane and the team investigate a death threat, but find themselves in danger when a building explodes. Meanwhile, Lisbon confronts billionaire Walter Mashburn again when they meet during a case. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is kidnapped, but as Lisbon and the team go back over his previous cases in search of clues to the abductor's identity, they realise he had numerous enemies, any one of whom might be responsible. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane accepts the help of local astrologer Ellis Mars to solve the case of a triple murder involving two police officers. John Billingsley (True Blood) guest stars in an edition of the crime drama directed by leading actor Simon Baker. With Robin Tunney and Owain Yeoman.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The CBI tries to solve the murder of a Santa Claus impersonator, and Jane is questioned by an independent investigator in connection with the death of cop-killer Todd Johnson, who was set on fire while in police custody. Drama, starring Simon Baker, Robin Tunney, Owain Yeoman and Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger meets Meredith, the most interesting woman in Langley Falls, and he struggles to create a new, more fabulous persona to keep up with her. When he fails, Francine suggests the dejected alien embark on a journey of self-discovery, which doesn't go exactly as planned. Meanwhile, Stan and the others overdo it during a workout, and end up feeling too sore to move, giving Klaus the chance to throw himself a party.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger talks Francine into taking advantage of Stan's absence by playing the `Widow Game', which involves the two of them posing as widows in order to gain sympathy - and free stuff. However, the fun is spoiled when Francine begins to seriously contemplate how she would survive if Stan really were to die. Meanwhile, Steve and his friends stage wrestling matches in the basement, but things get out of hand when an uninvited participant shows up.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine finds herself on display to members of the public, after a cast of her most intimate body part becomes `body art', and features in a museum's exhibition.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The Griffins struggle financially, but then Stewie suddenly becomes a star after appearing in an advertosement for peanut butter.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian learns Rush Limbaugh has arranged a book signing at the Quahog Mall, and decides to attend the event to give the outspoken radio talk-show host a piece of his mind. However, when Rush unexpectedly comes to his rescue, the liberal-thinking dog has a political change of heart.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers that Lois's dad Carter is having an affair and is forced to keep the dalliance a secret, but causes embarrassment by accidentally revealing the truth. In the aftermath, Lois's mother demands a divorce and Peter finds himself helping Carter adjust to life as a bachelor.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: The Nova-Centauris-burgh Board of Tourism Presents: American Dad.
programme.desc: Steve and his friends start up a live-action role-playing game, and Francine finds herself strangely drawn to the fantasy world they create. Meanwhile, Stan opens a marine animal theme park in the Smith family home.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan begins to question Christianity after Steve asks some uncomfortable questions about everything written in the Bible. Now facing a crisis of faith, the secret agent takes his family to Korea to investigate reports of reinvented Noah's Ark.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter is placed under house arrest and fills his time by turning the basement into a bar - where Lois finds fame as the resident singer. Meanwhile, Stewie tries to build a time machine in a bid to avoid teething pain. Animated comedy, with the voices of Alex Borstein and Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter accidentally injures the best player in his company's softball team, and tries to get on Mr Weed's good side by inviting new neighbour Joe to join as a replacement - unaware that he is a wheelchair user. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth McFarlane and Alex Borstein.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: The Best Christmas Story Never Told.
programme.desc: Stan blames Jane Fonda for ruining the festivities when the illumination of the town Christmas tree is cancelled, and travels back in time to 1970 to kill her. However, he inadvertently changes history and returns to a radically different present.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan's hero George W Bush turns up at the Smith residence for dinner. Roger and Steve try to convince the president that they know the whereabouts of Osama bin Laden and ply him with alcohol, while Hayley looks for an opportunity to disgrace their important guest publicly.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The family sets out on a trip to New York in a bid to win back Chris's place in a Scout group, but Peter takes a wrong turn en route and ends up at a Native American casino - where Lois becomes obsessed with the slot machines. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth Green and Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: A heatwave hits Quahog, and Peter enters Brian in a dog show in the hope of winning enough money to buy a new air-conditioning unit. However, the erudite canine feels humiliated and runs away from home - only to find himself hauled off to the pound and sentenced to death.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan begins to feel that his CIA career has stalled and decides to become an entrepreneur. Filled with zeal, he opens a teddy bear factory - but Hayley is offended by his business ethics and takes drastic measures to improve them.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger is rejected by Steve and seeks out another human companion - who soon becomes abusive, prompting Hayley to extricate him from the relationship. Meanwhile, Stan takes a tour of the Mr Pibb factory and meets the man himself. Featuring the voices of Patton Oswalt and Peter Graves.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the case of a marine who dropped dead while scaling a wall on an assault course, and a fellow soldier reveals that he was heavily involved with an underground fight club, where competitors would battle for cash. Meanwhile, having returned to work after compassionate leave, Vance discovers paperwork and a key in his late wife's effects that lead him to a safety deposit box containing a stash of cash.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While transporting the corpse of Lt Gordon Roth to the morgue, a flat tyre brings Ducky and Jimmy to a halt and they are abducted and taken to a remote cabin - where one of their captors wants the post-mortem to take place. Back at the scene, Abby finds a blood sample that does not belong to the victim, who in fact bore little resemblance to the picture of Roth in his old school yearbook. Guest starring Valerie Cruz (The Following).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is stabbed to death after stepping out of her shower, becoming the latest victim of the Dead Rose Slasher. Gibbs is approached by his old friend and barber Frankie Dean, who shares his concern that his son Cameron may be the killer. He explains that a photo-fit released to the media resembles him, and the attacks stopped during a period coinciding with his three-year stint in the navy. Meanwhile, Tony has to take probationary agent Ned Dorneget under his wing.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Marine sergeant Teddy Lemere is killed by a sniper in Afghanistan just after his sniffer dog helps guide a young child out of a minefield. Back in the US, his widow Ruby tells Gibbs and the team that she had recently received a message from her husband saying he might have upset a few people. Abby retrieves a tiny shard of the sniper's bullet from Ted's helmet and finds that it was made in America.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A doctor dies on board the USS Borealis during a heavy storm and when the ship is brought into Norfolk Naval Yard, Ducky's investigation reveals a telltale mark on the victim's carotid artery, suggesting he was injected with poison. Initial inquiries focus on a petty officer with a history of drug use who may have wanted the doctor to remain silent about his problems. American drama, starring David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A journalist is found dead at a martial arts contest, raising the possibility that two competitors are guilty of murder. The team calls the suspects in for an interview, but Jane comes up with an alternative plan to ensnare the culprit. Elsewhere, an internal investigator questions Rigsby about his father. Drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A criminal profiler joins the team to help investigate a double murder case that bears resemblances to crimes committed a decade previously by a serial killer known as the Caveman. Jane clashes with the newcomer's scientific approach and disagrees with her theories about potential suspects - so he fabricates a piece of evidence to throw her off course in the hope of outwitting the real culprit. Crime drama, guest starring Linda Park (Raines).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and Rigsby travel to Crane Creek, where they examine the murder of a film-maker who has been shot at close range. The local police identify a man who was accused of killing his wife two years previously as the main suspect, but when the agents close in, he takes the employees and customers at City Hall hostage, including Jane, who was settling a parking fine at the time. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Van Pelt looks after a man who is willing to testify against a drug dealer, but her career is put in jeopardy when the witness is murdered. Jane learns the identity of the killer after questioning the victim's daughter, so the team rushes her to a safe house and waits for the hired gun to finish the job - only to be shocked by who appears. Crime drama, starring Amanda Righetti.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The team investigates when a struggling gold prospector is killed, but Lisbon is injured during the opening stages of the case and Hightower takes her place. The detectives speak to the man's family and become suspicious when they discover his girlfriend had bought a one-way ticket to San Francisco a week earlier. Simon Baker, Robin Tunney and Aunjanue Ellis star.(n)

programme.desc: Comedy drama series based on Phil McGraw's early career as a expert jury consultant, beginning as Bull and his team lend their services to a wealthy scion accused of murder.(n)

Historical drama, starring Natalie Portman, Scarlett Johansson and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.desc: Celebrity chef Jamie Oliver uses wild mushrooms picked in his local forest to rustle up simple dishes including risotto, bruschetta and a venison and funghi stroganoff. His mentor Gennaro Contaldo explains the dangers of some varieties, before sampling the recipes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver joins a partridge shoot, finding out from a gamekeeper how to get involved with the countryside. He then rustles up dishes using fresh game birds and recipes inspired by Asian, European and traditional British cuisine, designed to get the best flavour possible.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef looks for things to do with pumpkins other than turning them into traditional Halloween lanterns. Recipes include a roast duck and pumpkin winter salad with Asian dressing, a soup and a lighter snack - squash fairy cakes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Pop star Paloma Faith relives childhood memories by preparing a Portuguese salt cod dish at the pop-up cafe on Southend Pier. Jamie Oliver serves sticky Chinese ribs, Jimmy Doherty brews his own DIY craft beer, and the boys take up the case of the delicious and nutritious meats that have fallen out of favour.(n)

programme.desc: Adam Richman visits an English-style seaside eatery and an Amish restaurant in Florida.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Las Vegas, where he is challenged to eat a 6lb, 2ft-long burrito.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman competes in the Doughman, a charity relay race in Durham, North Carolina, that features challenging eating elements.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food

programme.desc: Adam Richman travels across the sea to Honolulu in Hawaii, where he faces a giant pancake challenge.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In San Francisco, Adam Richman faces a super-sized burrito and the infamous local belt-buster known as the Kryptonite sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Springfield, Illinois, and takes on one of America's oldest eating competitions - the Firebrand Chili Challenge.(n)

programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten shares pot-luck party secrets with local farmers Katie and Amanda, who are throwing a start of season event.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten shares her favourite cheese recipes, preparing a show-stopping spinach and cheddar souffle.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten makes a frozen mocha mousse, easy French apple galettes and balsamic strawberries.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares a housewarming dinner for a friend.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond creates a menu with black beans at the centre, including mango guacamole and taco pizza, as well as grilled veggie burritos and a quick black bean burger.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's sister visits the ranch, so frittata, kale citrus salad, mystery rolls and lemon and lime pound cake are on the menu for an evening of cooking and eating.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares a delicious Tex-Mex tailgate lunch, including a beef taco bar, green chilli queso, chipotle salsa and chilli beans and sugar cookies.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond cooks up four of her favourite treats, including pumpkin cinnamon rolls, sticky sweet baklava, white chocolate shortbread cookies and chocolate-dipped strawberries.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves up home-grown winter salad dishes, including a bagna cauda, a herb omelette, and a Japanese-style tuna sashimi with sprouting herb salad and a surprising dressing. Meanwhile, gardener Brian experiments with seeds to demonstrate the full array of colourful, tasty ingredients available in the cold, dark months.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up more simple dishes using home-grown produce. He is joined by a Welsh sheep farmer who tackles common misconceptions about lamb and explains how the conditions the animals are kept in affects the quality of the meat.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares recipes using leeks, including pappardelle and a `concertina' squid dish. He also explains why the underrated vegetables can be a real asset in the kitchen and offers advice on how to grow and store them.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves simple recipes using winter vegetables grown in his Essex garden. He prepares a seasonal coleslaw and bubble and squeak, and uses homegrown cabbage to make an Italian soup.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver turns his attention to recipes using furred game, including rabbit - once a staple on Britain's dinner tables - fed on the best vegetables from the chef's garden. programme.title: Bob Monkhouse: Million Joke Man
programme.desc: In the concluding episode, Paul O'Grady charts Bob Monkhouse's reinvention as the elder statesman of British comedy from 1994 to his death in 2003, and sees how at the end of his life Bob was performing some of his most outstanding comedic work.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Dawn French narrates this series finding out more about some of the nation's favourite performers, beginning with Kenneth Williams. In interviews with the most celebrated interrogators such as David Frost, Michael Parkinson, Terry Wogan and Russell Harty, the raconteur talks openly about his frustrations, phobias and darkest moments.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will Randolph Make a Good Impression?.
programme.desc: Hobbo's quest to find a man for Stella leads him to put up an advertisement, but the suitor who turns up lacks what it takes to tackle the widow and runs off. However, a chance to hit back emerges when Hobbo finds out who Stella's favourite movie character is.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Romance Springs a Leak.
programme.desc: When Hobbo learns that Howard feels he is taken for granted by Pearl and that Toby misses his former wife, he hatches a plan to sort out their love lives - with the help of flowers, a Mario Lanza recording and his own team of miming violinists.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Variations on a Theme of Father's Day.
programme.desc: Convinced that Nelly is his mother, Hobbo sends Howard to eavesdrop on her and Pearl as he tries to find out more about his father. However, when the women concoct some false information, the police start to take an interest in the men's activities. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, June Whitfield and Robert Fyfe.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del seizes a rare opportunity to make a quick profit and bring Trotters Independent Traders into the hi-tech world of satellite communications. Meanwhile, Rodney plunges to the depths of despair as his marriage continues to deteriorate. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2003. As Rodney and Cassandra prepare for the arrival of their own little plonker, the Trotter brothers must raise the money they need to pay back the Inland Revenue or risk losing their cherished flat in Nelson Mandela House - but an old photo soon takes the plot into much darker territory. David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong and John Challis star in the last-ever episode.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: An audition gives Raquel the chance of a lifetime - and perhaps more importantly, an excuse to get out of Nelson Mandela House. Del-Boy is as excited as she is about the prospect, but only because he sees himself as the man behind her rapid rise to stardom. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del becomes a showbiz entrepreneur after discovering a sensational Tom Jones-style singer at a local club. Teaming him up with Raquel, he wastes no time in booking the duo at a birthday party for the elderly mother of a local hoodlum - but it soon becomes clear his new signing is not everything he is cracked up to be. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones, with a guest appearance by Philip Pope.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del is invited to a school reunion at the Nag's Head organised by old adversary Roy Slater (Jim Broadbent), who has recently been released from prison and claims to have turned over a new leaf. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del seizes a rare opportunity to make a quick profit and bring Trotters Independent Traders into the hi-tech world of satellite communications. Meanwhile, Rodney plunges to the depths of despair as his marriage continues to deteriorate. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: An audition gives Raquel the chance of a lifetime - and perhaps more importantly, an excuse to get out of Nelson Mandela House. Del-Boy is as excited as she is about the prospect, but only because he sees himself as the man behind her rapid rise to stardom. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Return of the sitcom about a British Pakistani family in Sparkhill, Birmingham, whose father sees himself as a pillar of the community - even if nobody else does. Mr Khan is lumbered with looking after his mother-in-law, until a miracle happens - she announces she wants to move into a home. The head of a local care centre arrives, plans are made and Khan is over the moon - until he realises his elderly relative is worth quite a bit of money. Can he stop her leaving after all? Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor and Maya Sondhi star, with a guest appearance from Sally Lindsay.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: With Shazia and Amjad's wedding fast approaching, the Khans invite the Maliks over for dinner, concerned they have never hit it off with the groom's mother - and also hope Amjad's father can help Mr Khan get onto a business committee. They pull out all the stops to impress, with Mrs Khan cooking up a storm in the kitchen, parlour games being organised, Mr Khan buying a new suit, and the couple even having a new piece of furniture to show off. But then an unexpected phone call jeopardises the event. Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor star, with guest appearances by Ted Robbins and Colin McFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan takes on more shifts at the supermarket, leaving her husband in charge of the house - and in his new role, he introduces strict rules and even sends his younger daughter to London for work experience at a mosque. Never one to miss out on a bargain, he then abuses his wife's staff discount card and starts selling nappies to his neighbours at a healthy profit. But when Alia returns from the capital with his domineering sister-in-law Aunty Noor, it looks like his dodgy scam is in danger of being exposed to Mrs Khan. Nina Wadia guest stars in the sitcom, with Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The students plan a spectacular protest to prevent council officials demolishing their house. First-ever episode of the anarchic comedy. Rik Mayall, Adrian Edmondson, Nigel Planer and Christopher Ryan star, with Alexei Sayle and mod band Nine Below Zero.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The hard-up housemates strike oil in the basement, and think they have found the answer to their financial woes. However, super-smooth Mike decides the time is ripe for a coup, and declares himself house-dictator. Anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayall, Ade Edmondson, Nigel Planer and Christopher Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Bill Hicks: Relentless
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the American comedian and satirist at the 1991 Just for Laughs comedy festival in Montreal.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: Foul-tempered proprietor Bernard struggles to fill in his tax return after his accountant goes on the run. Comedy, starring Dylan Moran, Bill Bailey and Tamsin Greig, with Martin Freeman (The Office, Sherlock).(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: Manny starts his new job at the bookshop, but has to deal with strange customers and a very peculiar boss - until Fran steps in. Comedy, starring Dylan Moran, Bill Bailey and Tamsin Greig.(n)

programme.title: Monty Python's Best Bits (Mostly)
programme.desc: A celebration of all things Python. Bill Bailey, Harry Shearer and Kate Beckinsale are among those paying tribute, while classic clips include The Lumberjack Song. Presented by Hugh Bonneville.(n)

programme.title: Limmy's Show
programme.desc: Brian Limond returns with more sketches, skits and animations presenting his very personal take on modern life. Hapless late-night quiz show host Falconhoof introduces his new sidekick, while Dee Dee gets ready to take off into the space from the comfort of his own living room. Brian also introduces several of his latest comic creations, including a psychic whose communications from the other side rarely have happy endings.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files
programme.sub-title: The Hunt for the Red Decoder.
programme.desc: A full-scale search is organised for a missing piece of Russian decoding equipment - which has mysteriously turned up at Peter's house.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrew household echoes to the sound of laughter, as Margaret joins the local amateur dramatic society and Victor begins penning a sitcom script. However, his mother-in-law's bath-time accident and a run-in with British Telecom soon leave the curmudgeonly codger in no mood for jokes. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: A persistent door-to-door salesman makes grouchy Victor Meldrew see red - and an unending stream of junk mail through his letterbox threatens to push him over the brink into insanity. Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Angus Deayton star.(n)

programme.title: The Interviews
programme.desc: Key moments in the career of Ronnie Barker and Ronnie Corbett are recounted by combining clips of chat show appearances with sketches from their comedy series. Talking to the likes of David Frost, Michael Parkinson, Terry Wogan and Russell Harty, they discuss everything from their first meeting through to the very last TV programme they made together, give an insight into the inspiration behind some of their most famous sketches and what made them tick as a duo, and reveal why The Two Ronnies came to a premature end. Dawn French narrates.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby.
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones, with a guest appearance by Philip Pope.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: A nagging toothache forces a reluctant Del to visit the dentist, but he gets more than he bargained for when the receptionist falls for him and embarks on a Fatal Attraction-style campaign to get her hooks into him. Meanwhile, Cassandra's plan to have a baby takes its toll on Rodney, who has never been so exhausted in all his life. Christmas special from 1993.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby.
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan announces she is running a stall at the city farm to promote the supermarket's new organic range, but her husband couldn't be less interested. He wants to know why he, of all people, hasn't been invited to a royal reception in Birmingham being attended by none other than Prince Charles. But then he hears His Royal Highness may be dropping in to the city farm, and he sees his chance - only to discover he still won't get anywhere near the future king unless he can impress the formidable head of the welcoming committee, Marina Fairchild (Belinda Lang, 2point4 Children).(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Shazia is looking forward to having fun with her friends as the day of her hen party arrives, only for a few unwelcome guests to tag along - and she ends up being bombarded with everyone's stories of married life. Meanwhile, Amjad has his stag do, which is being organised by his future father-in-law Mr Khan, so surely nothing can go wrong. Back at the house, the groom is put in a compromising position - and when the two parties collide, the wedding is left hanging in the balance. Kate Robbins guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: The day of Shazia's wedding to Amjad finally dawns, but it doesn't get off to a great start when Mrs Khan falls out with her daughter and refuses to attend the ceremony. This leaves Mr Khan to sort out the mess - but in his none-too-subtle attempt to get his wife back on side, he only manages to make matters worse - then the groom goes missing and Mrs Malik makes a startling revelation.(n)

programme.title: The Full Monty
programme.desc: Six unemployed men from Sheffield decide to become strippers for one night only in a bid to raise extra money. However, with no dancing experience and far from perfect physiques, the men rely on the unique selling point of complete nudity to impress the punters. Comedy, starring Robert Carlyle, Mark Addy, Tom Wilkinson, Hugo Speer and Paul Barber.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The three remaining hopefuls join forces to practise a fine-dining menu before the penultimate task of the contest - to prepare one course each of a three-course menu, designed by Italian chef Massimo Bottura and judged by five of his contemporaries - Marcus Wareing, Daniel Clifford, Andrew Fairlie, Anthony Demetre and Francesco Mazzei. This is the amateurs' chance to show the best of the best that they have what it takes to one day join their ranks. But will nerves get the better of them?.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After seven weeks of challenges, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax. The three would-be chefs pull out all the stops as they produce their final three courses, the likes of which they have never cooked before. Then it's over to judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace to decide which of the trio deserves to succeed last year's victor Ping Coombes and be crowned MasterChef Champion 2015.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food starts to smell the salty Mediterranean sea on the warm breeze and serves freshly grilled sardines with salad and cold rose wine for the boat crew as they reach Narbonne. Meanwhile, Louis, the chef onboard Anjodi, rustles up seafood with squid ink pasta.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef journeys along the Etang de Thau, famous for its oysters and mussels, before mooring his barge in the port of Sete, where Bastille Day is being celebrated. He also rustles up seafood ragout and roast black bream before travelling on to Marseille to tackle the most famous fish dish of all - bouillabaisse.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's epic journey from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean comes to an end as he takes the final leg of his gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France. Arriving in Marseille, he samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as showing a variety of traditional recipes. He also cooks roast black bream and finds time to send Chalky a postcard.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fruits of the Sea
programme.desc: The chef rustles up more delicious seafood delights inspired by his travels. As spring arrives in Cornwall, Rick cooks seafood paella, spicy Thai fish curry, and scallops.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fruits of the Sea
programme.desc: The chef rustles up more delicious seafood delights inspired by his travels.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fruits of the Sea
programme.desc: A fisherwoman in Padstow harbour cooks squid with red wine for the chef. Rick also visits Brittany in France to sample its local fish restaurants and cafes, before discovering how to make the perfect bouillabaisse in Marseilles.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Fruits of the Sea
programme.desc: The chef goes hunting for spider crabs to whip up a dish of crabmeat with wine and garlic, before revealing a few tricks of the trade to the chefs at Blenheim Palace as they prepare a seafood banquet.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The three remaining hopefuls join forces to practise a fine-dining menu before the penultimate task of the contest - to prepare one course each of a three-course menu, designed by Italian chef Massimo Bottura and judged by five of his contemporaries - Marcus Wareing, Daniel Clifford, Andrew Fairlie, Anthony Demetre and Francesco Mazzei. This is the amateurs' chance to show the best of the best that they have what it takes to one day join their ranks. But will nerves get the better of them?.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After seven weeks of challenges, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax. The three would-be chefs pull out all the stops as they produce their final three courses, the likes of which they have never cooked before. Then it's over to judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace to decide which of the trio deserves to succeed last year's victor Ping Coombes and be crowned MasterChef Champion 2015.(n)

programme.title: Madhur Jaffrey's Curry Nation
programme.desc: The presenter arrives in Scotland, where she discovers haggis curries in Glasgow, and a cafe selling Punjabi food in Edinburgh.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food starts to smell the salty Mediterranean sea on the warm breeze and serves freshly grilled sardines with salad and cold rose wine for the boat crew as they reach Narbonne. Meanwhile, Louis, the chef onboard Anjodi, rustles up seafood with squid ink pasta.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef journeys along the Etang de Thau, famous for its oysters and mussels, before mooring his barge in the port of Sete, where Bastille Day is being celebrated. He also rustles up seafood ragout and roast black bream before travelling on to Marseille to tackle the most famous fish dish of all - bouillabaisse.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's epic journey from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean comes to an end as he takes the final leg of his gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France. programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall hopes to raise lots of money for a good cause when he donates one of the pigs to his landlord's medieval fair, while Marge the cow is introduced to the local bull.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: After torrential rain has ruined his hay and tomato crops, Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall is joined by expert foragers Nick and Paddy to pick wild mushrooms that have benefitted from the wet weather.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall harvests his entire crop of tomatoes in anticipation of the local farmers' market, where he hopes to sell the fruit in a range of deli products such as ketchup and tomato and apple butter.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh worries about feeding his animals and, in return for a dozen bales of hay, volunteers to be the quarry for local hunters. After being caught by a pack of slavering hounds, he decides to try a more dignified approach - a party where guests `bring a bale' instead of a bottle.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall continues his Dorset downshifting experiment, and gets busy building high-rise poultry accommodation in his latest scheme to breed the perfect roast-worthy chicken. He also enlists the help of canoeing instructor Nigel Tuffley in navigating the River Brit.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall has a few sleepless nights as his first ewe gives birth to twins. He also fights for the angling rights to catch the huge carp inhabiting the muddy estate lake, and hopes a special recipe will convince the landlord Antony Hitchens.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: It's late May and the vet has bad news for Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall - Marge the cow is not pregnant, lambing is finished and the eggs are addled. But it's not all doom and gloom, as huge shoals of cuttlefish are massing off the Dorset coast.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: It's mid-June and Hugh decides to sell his peas and beans at Bridport Farmers' Market to raise cash for the hire of haymaking equipment. When the mowing is completed he invites local felt-making experts to turn his sheep's fleeces into a fashionable garment, and is asked to make the tea for the village cricket match.(n)

programme.title: If You're Not in the Obit, Eat Breakfast
programme.desc: Carl Reiner seeks out some of his nonagenarian friends, including Norman Lear, Mel Brooks, Betty White, Dick Van Dyke, Stan Lee and Iris Apfel—and even a few centenarian ones—to discuss the secrets of their longevity and still-active lifestyles. Tony Bennett performs the film's opening title song, "The Best Is Yet to Come."(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Maajid Nawaz; Richard Painter; Bianna Golodryga; Charlie Sykes; Bradley Whitford
programme.desc: Maajid Nawaz; Richard Painter; Bianna Golodryga; Charlie Sykes; Bradley Whitford. Counter-extremism expert Maajid Nawaz and attorney Richard Painter are the interview guests. The panelists are journalist Bianna Golodryga, political commentator Charlie Sykes and actor Bradley Whitford(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: Steve Carell is Maxwell Smart, a covert agent who often finds himself out of his depths but never out of options. It's CONTROL veruss KAOS all over again as this action comedy based on a beloved hit TV series from the sixties pits Agent 86 against a nuclear scheme by the evil spy conglomerate. Partnered with sexy and capable Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway), he navigates the world of multifunction pocketknives and exploding dental floss to hilarious effect. The all-star cast is rounded up by Dwayne Johnson, Terence Stamp, Alan Arkin and James Caan(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: An accountant is pulled into the deadly world of espionage by his former nerdy classmate who is now a CIA assassin(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: Raucous comedy starring John Cho and Kal Penn, with Jon Hurwitz and Hayden Schlossberg taking the directors' chairs for this outing in addition to their regular writing duties. When the stoner duo unwisely smuggle their drugs paraphernalia on to a US bound flight from Amsterdam, US Homeland Security misinterpret their intentions and they are promptly shipped off to the infamous US Army detention camp in Cuba. And so the scene is set for a series of none-too-subtle gags as our THC-loving heroes seek to make their escape. Sophisticated it may not be, but if crude and politically incorrect humour is your thing then there are certainly plenty of laughs to be had here. And the film also seems to raise the question of who's the more paranoid: two long-term marijuana users or the US Government(n)

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: This sparkling biopic of literary editor Max Perkins centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe. As Wolfe becomes consumed with his lengthy novels, Perkins struggles to reel in his talent in order to deliver another best-seller for Scribner Publishing during the 1930s(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: Comedy about an uptight career woman whose broody impulses lead her to hire a surrogate to bear her a child. However, the obnoxious woman who agrees to carry her baby does not actually fall pregnant and has instead hatched a plan to keep the fee without having to give birth(n)

programme.desc: 06/14/2017. An interview with Sergey Kovalev; a breakdown of the Andre Ward-Kovalev rematch; a recap of Terence Crawford's New York fight; and a look back at the David Tua vs. Ike Ibeabuchi 1997 heavyweight bout(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: An investment banker attempts to cope with his wife's sudden death by becoming obsessed with physically deconstructing technologies that surround him. His complaints to a vending machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer service rep(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: Peter is a composer and a likable sad sack who's devastated when his girlfriend of five years, Sarah Marshall, the star of a cheesy CSI-style crime show, dumps him. He weeps, he rails, he mopes. Finally, his step-brother Brian suggests Hawaii, so Peter heads for a resort on Oahu where, as he's checking in, he sees Sarah and her new beau, Aldous, a polymorphously perverse English rocker(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: Kaulder (Vin Diesel), a witch hunter, is cursed with immortality by the Witch Queen (Julie Englbrecht) right before she dies at his hand. As a result, he has been tracking down evil witches for centuries while leading a lonely existence separated from his wife and daughter. When the Witch Queen returns from the dead seeking retribution, a battle ensues and the fate of humanity hangs in the balance. Directed by Breck Eisner (The Crazies). Cast includes Elijah Wood, Rose Leslie, Ólafur Darri Ólafsson and Michael Caine(n)

programme.title: Babylon A.D.
programme.desc: In the near-future, tough mercenary Toorop is hired to transport a girl from Russia to New York, unaware that she is believed by some to be the new messiah. Sci-fi(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Mummy'
programme.desc: A look at "The Mummy," a 2017 horror film about a cruel princess of ancient Egypt who wreaks havoc on humanity after she is accidentally resurrected. The film stars Tom Cruise, Sofia Boutella and Annabelle Wallis, and is directed by Alex Kurtzman(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: This fascinating thriller follows the rise and fall of Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twin gangsters who built a criminal empire in London during the 1950s and '60s using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen(n)

programme.title: Stuart Little 2
programme.desc: Stuart must protect a bird from the clutches of the evil Falcon in this sequel(n)

programme.title: Cursed
programme.desc: "Scream" director Wes Craven and writer Kevin Williamson reunite for this bloodcurdling chiller. It's the story of siblings (Christina Ricci, Jesse Eisenberg) who are bitten by a mysterious beast, then gradually turn into werewolves. Can they break the deadly curse? Scott Baio and Craig Kilborn have cameos. Joshua Jackson, Portia de Rossi, Shannon Elizabeth, Mya, Kristina Anapau(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two siblings uncover a harrowing secret about their grandparents while spending a week at their remote farm in Pennsylvania(n)

programme.title: The Number 23
programme.desc: Jim Carrey and Virginia Madsen star in this dark psychological thriller from director Joel Schumacher. Walter Sparrow is leading a contented life until his wife Agatha innocently gives him a battered old paperback as a gift. As he reads, Sparrow is astonished by the parallels between his life and that of the novel's protagonist, Fingerling. But as the plot progresses it grows darker, featuring themes of transgressive sex, suicide and murder. It also hinges around Fingerling's obsession with the number 23 - a prime number that seems to pop up everywhere in the universe once you start to notice it. It's not long before 23 takes a similar hold on Sparrow. And, when he begins unjustly to view Agatha in the same distrustful light that Fingerling views his own spouse Fabrizia, it seems as if Sparrow has locked on to the same tragic trajectory as the story's lead character. Or can he find a way to wrench himself from the novel's grip?(n)

programme.desc: Romantic comedy in which a bankrupt entrepreneur tries to recoup some of her losses by getting a washed-out boxer she picked up as a tax loss back into the ring. Unfortunately, her protege is not exactly knocked out by the idea(n)

programme.title: The Tuxedo

Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs, Debi Mazar, Ritchie Coster, Peter Stormare(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: Matt Damon, Ben Affleck and Robin Williams star in Gus Van Sant's Oscar-winning film, with Damon as Will Hunting, a school janitor who also happens to be a savant with a photographic memory and the ability to solve seemingly impossible math problems. 'Caught' at the blackboard by teacher Stellan Skarsgard (Gerald Launbeau) at the same time as he faces problems with the police, Damon is offered a choice - prison or counselling with an equally stubborn therapist (Robin Williams). From their sessions comes the film's drama as Damon is forced to deal with the tensions between his blue collar present and his potential future(n)

programme.title: The Peanuts Movie
programme.desc: Charlie Brown, Snoopy, Woodstock and friends embark on an epic adventure in this charming adaptation of the beloved comic strip(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip
programme.desc: Alvin, Simon and Theodore head out on the road in a desperate race to find Dave after they are led to believe that he is about to propose to his girlfriend and leave them behind forever(n)

programme.title: Beautiful Creatures
programme.desc: When a young man named Ethan falls for Lena, a new girl in his small town, he discovers she comes from a mysterious family, all of whom all possess supernatural powers. Together, they team up to break a curse that casts Lena's entire future in doubt(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: In 1960s South Carolina, a young white girl and her black caregiver are taken in by an eccentric trio of sisters(n)

programme.title: Cocoon
programme.desc: Oscar-winning sci-fi fantasy in which the residents of a Florida rest- home get a new lease of life when they stumble across an alien 'fountain of youth' in a disused vacation house. Unbeknown to them, aliens have been using the swimming pool in the house to store their cocooned brethren, giving the waters a powerful, rejuvenating quality. Don Ameche won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actor. A sequel followed in 1988(n)

programme.title: Lost & Found
programme.desc: Just how low will a guy sink in order to impress the woman of his dreams? How does stealing her dog sound? In Lost and Found, David Spade plays Dylan, who is about to open an new restaurant and has finally found the perfect apartment. The apartment just gets better when he meets his new neighbor, Lila (Sophie Marceau), a very beautiful women who has recently come to the United States from France. However, Lila has just gotten out of a bad relationship with René (Patrick Bruel), who doesn't want to leave her alone, so she has little interest in romance, preferring to devote herself to her cello and her dog Jack. One day, Jack runs away and Dylan finds him; when he returns the pooch to Lila, it's the first time she's been willing to speak in full sentences to him, though not for very long. Faster than you can say "That idea is so crazy it just might work!", Dylan decides to kidnap Jack; when Lila thinks the dog is lost, Dylan will generously volunteer to help look for him, which will give Dylan a chance to impress Lila when he's able to find Jack so quickly. Sure enough, Dylan swipes the dog, but from that point on the plan hardly goes the way he had hoped. Star David Spade also co-wrote the screenplay with J.B. Cook and Marc Meeks; the supporting cast includes Martin Sheen, Mitchell Whitfield, Artie Lang and Jon Lovitz(n)
